commit_message:
Reenable multiple elasticsearch indices

See spec:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/searchlight/+spec/reenable-multiple-indices

This patch adds functionality to allow queries to work with multiple indices.

Change-Id: I0a2a7f98870b373804bcc285d5835e99f841009b
Implements-blueprint: reenable-multiple-indices

commit_message:
contraint/base: add resource tag on execs

Add [ 'pacemaker', 'pacemaker_constraint'] tags to the Exec resources in
constrain/base.pp, so we can easily make some orchestration.

Change-Id: Icea7537cea330da59fe108c9b874c04f2b94d062

subject: Revert "Fix default keystone auth_plugin for nova/neutron"
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-10 17:40:39.000000000', 'files': ['spec/classes/nova_network_neutron_spec.rb', 'manifests/network/neutron.pp'], 'message': 'Revert "Fix default keystone auth_plugin for nova/neutron"

This reverts commit 271a2587a38c6a396213c95aaa8a690fcc283091.

This patch seems to have caused the TripleO upgrades job to fail
in that running Nova instances stopped working after an upgrade.

Could be there is a missing relationship or something in Puppet or
perhaps something else keystone related but updating to this
as a default seems it could break things.

Related bug: #1580076

Change-Id: I783fba6cbd3ba292d6ed64be2dd0772e20a0896d
'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Fix default keystone auth_plugin for nova/neutron"

This reverts commit 271a2587a38c6a396213c95aaa8a690fcc283091.

This patch seems to have caused the TripleO upgrades job to fail
in that running Nova instances stopped working after an upgrade.

Could be there is a missing relationship or something in Puppet or
perhaps something else keystone related but updating to this
as a default seems it could break things.

Related bug: #1580076

Change-Id: I783fba6cbd3ba292d6ed64be2dd0772e20a0896d

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-03 20:31:28.000000000', 'files': ['jenkins/scripts/generate_puppetfile.sh', 'jenkins/scripts/propose_update.sh', 'jenkins/jobs/puppet-module-jobs.yaml', 'zuul/layout.yaml'], 'message': 'Implement periodic job to update Puppet OpenStack constraints

In Puppet OpenStack CI, we use r10k to clone Puppet OpenStack modules
and all their dependencies from different places.
The Puppetfile is useful for both unit and functional tests, so we have
a consistency in what we test.

Until now, we were managing this Puppetfile without automation.
From time to time, we were updating the file but it does not scale,
regarding the work that needs to be done and the amount of dependencies
that never stop to grow up.

We recently implemented a script that is called
generate_puppetfile.sh (see dependency). This script aims to generate a
Puppetfile by cloning OpenStack & External modules.
The script will fetch tags and take the most recent one.
The script works as it is now, please look:
https://review.openstack.org/300696
And the Puppetfile that is generated.

This patch is an attempt to automate the run of this script, by using
the periodic job that is already in place for many other projects.

More features will come in next iterations:
* support stable branches
* add more logic in the script to detect whether or not tags exist (all
  our current modules have tags, but we never know...)

Change-Id: Id23ba86487d2223861b21941fa04acac0d49e3f3
'}]
commit_message:
Implement periodic job to update Puppet OpenStack constraints

In Puppet OpenStack CI, we use r10k to clone Puppet OpenStack modules
and all their dependencies from different places.
The Puppetfile is useful for both unit and functional tests, so we have
a consistency in what we test.

Until now, we were managing this Puppetfile without automation.
From time to time, we were updating the file but it does not scale,
regarding the work that needs to be done and the amount of dependencies
that never stop to grow up.

We recently implemented a script that is called
generate_puppetfile.sh (see dependency). This script aims to generate a
Puppetfile by cloning OpenStack & External modules.
The script will fetch tags and take the most recent one.
The script works as it is now, please look:
https://review.openstack.org/300696
And the Puppetfile that is generated.

This patch is an attempt to automate the run of this script, by using
the periodic job that is already in place for many other projects.

More features will come in next iterations:
* support stable branches
* add more logic in the script to detect whether or not tags exist (all
  our current modules have tags, but we never know...)

Change-Id: Id23ba86487d2223861b21941fa04acac0d49e3f3

commit_message:
Use neutron-vpnaas grenade plugin in grenade jobs

Now that neutron-vpnaas is a plugin, it needs an explicit
grenade plugin to shutdown the agent for the upgrade. The
devstack neutron code used to handle this but it was removed
in Ie5fc0d2a45c1b564f98c69ec9ea6fbdeeb465d32.

Change-Id: Iaaf02b51dff631758dd908b605f21ff1663fd858
Closes-Bug: #1579235

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-22 19:35:53.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/libvirt/driver.py', 'nova/virt/libvirt/config.py'], 'message': 'add FD guest memory backing

DO NOT MERGE

- This change introduces a  new preallocated
  file descriptor based memory backing for
  qemu guest.
- This change enabled vhost-user to be used
  without hugepages.
- This patchset is a poc to demonstrate the
  ablity to use vhost-user with ovs-dpdk
  and non hugepages backed guest
- This patchset uses the <qemu:commandline>
  xml element to correctly create the memory
  backing as libvirt does not support
  it directly.

Questions:
- Is it ok to use <qemu:commandline> in nova?
- could the  <qemu:commandline> approch be used
  initally and at a later date swap to a native
  xml element if support was added to libvirt?
- Should the file discripter backed memory be
  used as a default or should it be requested
  as a memory backing as hugepages is today?
  e.g. hw:mem_page_size=FD or hw:mem_page_size=FD4K

Ill be at the summit if anyone wants to discuss.

Change-Id: Ia6216acc64b4ca3459377e5abae66e7af282e87e
'}]
commit_message:
add FD guest memory backing

DO NOT MERGE

- This change introduces a  new preallocated
  file descriptor based memory backing for
  qemu guest.
- This change enabled vhost-user to be used
  without hugepages.
- This patchset is a poc to demonstrate the
  ablity to use vhost-user with ovs-dpdk
  and non hugepages backed guest
- This patchset uses the <qemu:commandline>
  xml element to correctly create the memory
  backing as libvirt does not support
  it directly.

Questions:
- Is it ok to use <qemu:commandline> in nova?
- could the  <qemu:commandline> approch be used
  initally and at a later date swap to a native
  xml element if support was added to libvirt?
- Should the file discripter backed memory be
  used as a default or should it be requested
  as a memory backing as hugepages is today?
  e.g. hw:mem_page_size=FD or hw:mem_page_size=FD4K

Ill be at the summit if anyone wants to discuss.

Change-Id: Ia6216acc64b4ca3459377e5abae66e7af282e87e

Setting it here manually for now and following up in puppet-nova.

commit_message:
Set nova neutron auth back to 'v3password'.

Puppet-nova recently changed the default neutron auth setting
in I3416ae594e972e40ff0336779258a887987e46b1 to 'password'.

This single setting seems to break the tripleo upgrades job.

Setting it here manually for now and following up in puppet-nova.

Closes-bug: #1580076

Change-Id: I3f38a3e1ef3378a272a51ecbc1e8a801c8d3608a

Due to data container problem, we need to use kolla_docker
in stable/liberty. That turned out to be much more work
than we initially thought, and instead it was easier
to reuse mitaka code and make it possible to deploy
liberty OpenStack with it.

1. Point tarballs to versions shipped with Liberty.
2. Change version to 1.1.0 in the places required.

   centos/oraclelinux binary builds.

   of keystoneclient from Liberty.

   and ubuntu.

   introduced in Mitaka.

'}]
commit_message:
Changes needed to deploy liberty with mitaka code

Due to data container problem, we need to use kolla_docker
in stable/liberty. That turned out to be much more work
than we initially thought, and instead it was easier
to reuse mitaka code and make it possible to deploy
liberty OpenStack with it.

1. Point tarballs to versions shipped with Liberty.
2. Change version to 1.1.0 in the places required.
3. This change contains code for source builds and
   centos/oraclelinux binary builds.
4. Changes auth_type to auth_plugin to match expectations
   of keystoneclient from Liberty.
5. Use neutronv2 driver as required by Liberty.
6. Point binary repositories to correct locations or CentOS
   and ubuntu.
7. Revert usage of keystone_bootstrap.sh script that was
   introduced in Mitaka.
8. Use latest version of nova and neutron from source builds.
9. All source build file locations updated.
10. Remove use of nova-db

Closes-Bug: #1572632
Co-Authored-By: Steven Dake <stdake@cisco.com>
Change-Id: I7847c7f5da7b41b4a376b9a688baf85911eac65f

commit_message:
Add devref for provisioning_blocks module

This adds a devref doc for the provisioning_blocks
module with a high-level overview of how it works in addition
to a detailed description of how it is used specifically with
ML2, the L2 agents, and the DHCP agents.

create_rtr_2_fip_link() has IPDevice instances for each
end of the VETH pair it created, just use them to add the
link-local IP to each one.  Because this is a point-to-point
link, we don't add the broadcast address when we assign the IP,
so add a flag to IpAddrCommand() class to accomodate us.

commit_message:
DVR: Use existing IPDevice to add address on FIP VETH

create_rtr_2_fip_link() has IPDevice instances for each
end of the VETH pair it created, just use them to add the
link-local IP to each one.  Because this is a point-to-point
link, we don't add the broadcast address when we assign the IP,
so add a flag to IpAddrCommand() class to accomodate us.
This is also setup for a follow-on patch.

Partial-Bug: #1566383
Change-Id: I66d70afaf3c52861e0887d3f535d5327ea46b128

commit_message:
IAM Formatter

This patch provides library functions to convert IAM
(Identity and Access Management) object to token data.

subject: Fix issue with coercing valid_values to a tuple
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 8788, 'name': 'Miguel Angel Ajo', 'email': 'mangelajo@redhat.com', 'username': 'mangelajo'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-25 15:32:35.000000000', 'files': ['oslo_versionedobjects/tests/test_fields.py', 'oslo_versionedobjects/fields.py'], 'message': 'Fix issue with coercing valid_values to a tuple

A recent patch exposed valid_values via property, and cocerced the
result to a tuple to convey the immutable nature of them. This was
a good thought, but unfortunately breaks __repr__ stability, which
we use in the fixture to calculate the object hashes.

We could make the __repr__ dig into the raw types on the field
instead of using the property, but this is probably not the best and
smallest change at this point. If we can get everyone to start using
tuples for their value_values list, then we could land a change to
coerce and enforce that. Right now, we just need to fix the
unexpected regression.

Change-Id: I09b78e7f816fc26c69a3e9435c9d92d5acb5821b
'}]
commit_message:
Fix issue with coercing valid_values to a tuple

A recent patch exposed valid_values via property, and cocerced the
result to a tuple to convey the immutable nature of them. This was
a good thought, but unfortunately breaks __repr__ stability, which
we use in the fixture to calculate the object hashes.

We could make the __repr__ dig into the raw types on the field
instead of using the property, but this is probably not the best and
smallest change at this point. If we can get everyone to start using
tuples for their value_values list, then we could land a change to
coerce and enforce that. Right now, we just need to fix the
unexpected regression.

Change-Id: I09b78e7f816fc26c69a3e9435c9d92d5acb5821b

commit_message:
Removed npm-install macro

Once npm and nodejs are available on the build slaves via
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/242161/, the npm-install macro
is no longer necessary. This patch removes it.

Note: This should be merged after the single-use-slave images
have been rebuilt.

Change-Id: I71a7ccefff364b8f41777eb067372768226dae4a
Depends-On: I345fdf66b2af0daa5359e04bf1036d535a7a7218

subject: Change recursion depth to '1' for mock detection
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-10 13:51:46.000000000', 'files': ['trove/tests/unittests/trove_testtools.py'], 'message': "Change recursion depth to '1' for mock detection

With the addition of more python3 tests, the py34 jobs is
failing intermittently due to timeouts.  It seems that python3
is significantly slower in running the unittests, and *way*
slower in doing the dangling-mock detection. Setting the
recursion value to '1' will make the tests run faster while
we figure out the best strategy going forward.

Change-Id: I922c9c465f0009be5ccd399982ff5f6c7fe02416
"}]
commit_message:
Change recursion depth to '1' for mock detection

With the addition of more python3 tests, the py34 jobs is
failing intermittently due to timeouts.  It seems that python3
is significantly slower in running the unittests, and *way*
slower in doing the dangling-mock detection. Setting the
recursion value to '1' will make the tests run faster while
we figure out the best strategy going forward.

Change-Id: I922c9c465f0009be5ccd399982ff5f6c7fe02416

xenserver module from
vif.py, pool.py and volume_utils.py
to centralize location
nova/conf/xenserver.py

commit_message:
Neutron_LBaaSv2: Update Session Persistence Bug

* fixes the intermittent failures seen in the
  session persistence scenario test;  the update method
  in the test was not explictly setting session
  persistence to None when removing an already
  set session persistence object

Change-Id: Ib78a6d4c08912d960ac4e916c338a7b2b3707c33
Closes-Bug: #1577987

subject: Remove test_invalid_policy_raises_error
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-03 12:46:33.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/unit/test_policy.py'], 'message': "Remove test_invalid_policy_raises_error

This test is validating internal behavior of the oslo.policy
library. Since oslo.policy already has tests for this
function, we don't have to test it in keystone.

As of commit 83d209e in oslo.policy the test fails because
oslo.policy has been enhanced to support YAML and the test is
using valid YAML.

An alternative is to change the test to have a file that's
invalid YAML (remove the ']'), but then it might break again.

An alternative is to change the test to mock out the behavior,
but then the test would just be showing that if we mock out
rules.enforce to raise ValueError it does that.

Change-Id: I4ead61566000aedf62c9c48b0702ea30472c9925
"}]
commit_message:
Remove test_invalid_policy_raises_error

This test is validating internal behavior of the oslo.policy
library. Since oslo.policy already has tests for this
function, we don't have to test it in keystone.

As of commit 83d209e in oslo.policy the test fails because
oslo.policy has been enhanced to support YAML and the test is
using valid YAML.

An alternative is to change the test to have a file that's
invalid YAML (remove the ']'), but then it might break again.

An alternative is to change the test to mock out the behavior,
but then the test would just be showing that if we mock out
rules.enforce to raise ValueError it does that.

Change-Id: I4ead61566000aedf62c9c48b0702ea30472c9925

subject: [inspection] wait for the PXE DHCP by default and remove the carrier check
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6637, 'name': 'Sam Betts', 'email': 'sam@code-smash.net', 'username': 'sambetts'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 7080, 'name': 'Mathieu Mitchell', 'email': 'mat128@gmail.com', 'username': 'mat128'}, {'_account_id': 10239, 'name': 'Dmitry Tantsur', 'email': 'dtantsur@protonmail.com', 'username': 'dtantsur'}, {'_account_id': 10342, 'name': 'Jay Faulkner', 'display_name': 'JayF', 'email': 'jay@jvf.cc', 'username': 'JayF'}, {'_account_id': 10343, 'name': 'Jim Rollenhagen', 'email': 'jim@jimrollenhagen.com', 'username': 'jimrollenhagen'}, {'_account_id': 14525, 'name': 'Vasyl Saienko', 'email': 'vsaienko@mirantis.com', 'username': 'vsaienko'}, {'_account_id': 18893, 'name': 'Miles Gould', 'email': 'mgould@redhat.com', 'username': 'pozorvlak'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-10 16:13:31.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/tests/unit/test_inspector.py', 'ironic_python_agent/inspector.py', 'releasenotes/notes/inspection-wait-for-ips-v2-146016f758d7010c.yaml', 'ironic_python_agent/cmd/agent.py'], 'message': "[inspection] wait for the PXE DHCP by default and remove the carrier check

We hoped that checking /sys/class/net/XXX/carrier will allow us
to not wait for interfaces that are not connected at all.
In reality this field turned out to be unreliable. For example, it is
also set to 0 when interface is down or is being configured.
The bug https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1327255 shows
the case when carrier is 0 for all interfaces, including one that is
used to post back data, which is obvious non-sense.

This change removes check on carrier for the loop. To avoid 60 seconds
wait for people with several NIC's, it's changed to only wait for the
PXE booting NIC, which obviously must get an IP address.

This makes IP addresses in the inspection data for other NIC's somewhat
unreliable. A new option inspection_dhcp_all_interfaces is introduced
to allow waiting for all NIC's to get IP addresses.

This change should finally fix bug 1564954.

Change-Id: I8b04bf726980fdcf6bd536c6bb28e30ac50658fb
Related-Bug: #1564954
"}]
commit_message:
[inspection] wait for the PXE DHCP by default and remove the carrier check

We hoped that checking /sys/class/net/XXX/carrier will allow us
to not wait for interfaces that are not connected at all.
In reality this field turned out to be unreliable. For example, it is
also set to 0 when interface is down or is being configured.
The bug https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1327255 shows
the case when carrier is 0 for all interfaces, including one that is
used to post back data, which is obvious non-sense.

This change removes check on carrier for the loop. To avoid 60 seconds
wait for people with several NIC's, it's changed to only wait for the
PXE booting NIC, which obviously must get an IP address.

This makes IP addresses in the inspection data for other NIC's somewhat
unreliable. A new option inspection_dhcp_all_interfaces is introduced
to allow waiting for all NIC's to get IP addresses.

This change should finally fix bug 1564954.

Change-Id: I8b04bf726980fdcf6bd536c6bb28e30ac50658fb
Related-Bug: #1564954

that these are in git. To restore normal content, just remove the
generated files.

commit_message:
New engine facade from oslo_db: Step 1

Start using new engine facade.
Existing property session for Context is needed for backward
compatibility.
Temporary created class ContextBaseWithSession unless
reader and writer will be used in proper places.
Usage of lazy init for engine facade will be removed in next patch
set.

Partial-Bug: #1520719

Change-Id: I4f0693789f1c928ef47c5fdd982c147d1a9a89e1

commit_message:
SR-IOV driver and SimpleAgentMechanismDriverBase

Since commit 83c9578fcc5d06b634d48e0e186bebd60a60322e was merged, the
SR-IOV mechanism driver requires an agent in the compute nodes. This
change makes the SR-IOV mechanism driver to inherit from
SimpleAgentMechanismDriverBase, like all the other agent based ML2
drivers

Change-Id: Icffc097a42dd71546b97bb7b43edd1e205c9dd15

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-05 14:54:58.000000000', 'files': ['agent'], 'message': "Do restart mcollective after provisioning

nailgun agent must not change mcollective config after provisioning
cloudinit is responsible for that.

It may happen that nailgun agent may be started by cron earlier than
it is reconfigured and started by cloudinit. This leads to the
situation when cloudinit reconfigures mcollective and issues start
which doesn't do anything since it is already started by nailgun agent.
Finally, mcollective is left started with incorrect default
configuration.

Change-Id: I0c6f3720943ad21e22899368832e451bc906b098
Closes-Bug: #1455489
"}]
commit_message:
Do restart mcollective after provisioning

nailgun agent must not change mcollective config after provisioning
cloudinit is responsible for that.

It may happen that nailgun agent may be started by cron earlier than
it is reconfigured and started by cloudinit. This leads to the
situation when cloudinit reconfigures mcollective and issues start
which doesn't do anything since it is already started by nailgun agent.
Finally, mcollective is left started with incorrect default
configuration.

Change-Id: I0c6f3720943ad21e22899368832e451bc906b098
Closes-Bug: #1455489

commit_message:
Resolve links before using path as block device

If the charm code is passed symlinks to block devices (as is often the
case with newer MAAS substrate versions), resolve links before
attempting to use the block device for storage.

Charmhelpers were updated as well.

Testing done:

- Unit tests pass
- Tests pass
- Multiple Openstack Autopilot deployments pass

Change-Id: If966239502d0752c86e46f3f0aee96f43828aa08
Closes-Bug: 1577408
Signed-off-by: Chris Glass <chris.glass@canonical.com>

In python3, keys() of a dict isn't a list and cannot be indexed.

Closes-Bug: #1550184

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-05 19:33:43.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/fakes.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/test_client_cmode.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/test_client_7mode.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/fakes.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_netapp_ssc.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/nfs_base.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/test_block_cmode.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/test_nfs_base.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/block_cmode.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/client_cmode.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/client/client_7mode.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/netapp/dataontap/ssc_cmode.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/volume/drivers/netapp/test_utils.py'], 'message': 'NetApp: Decouple capacity volume stats collection

The NetApp cDOT drivers keep their pool capacities in the
data structures used for other pool attributes that support
various volume type extra specs.  But the capacity info is
fast-changing, while the other pool attributes rarely or never
change.  A subsequent patch will simplify the pool attribute
collection code by refreshing itself on a slow cadence using
loopingcall.  This patch splits the pool capacity collection
so that it may be called independently on each call to
_update_volume_stats.

Partially implements: blueprint replace-netapp-cdot-ssc-module
Change-Id: I526a611cf6459417c63366f9fa21f2a803727910
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp: Decouple capacity volume stats collection

The NetApp cDOT drivers keep their pool capacities in the
data structures used for other pool attributes that support
various volume type extra specs.  But the capacity info is
fast-changing, while the other pool attributes rarely or never
change.  A subsequent patch will simplify the pool attribute
collection code by refreshing itself on a slow cadence using
loopingcall.  This patch splits the pool capacity collection
so that it may be called independently on each call to
_update_volume_stats.

Partially implements: blueprint replace-netapp-cdot-ssc-module
Change-Id: I526a611cf6459417c63366f9fa21f2a803727910

commit_message:
Fix uuidgen not installed in some ubuntu installs

On some basic ubuntu install the uuidgen commands is not there causing
gnocchi installation to fail.
Add a new pre-install commands to install the package on ubuntu systems.

commit_message:
Fix view of quota limits on project/overview page

Current template works ok only when amount of charts satisfies
following criterion (currently satisfies):
(amount_of_charts - 1) % 2 == 0
In all other cases view is broken.

It was introduced by [1] commit.

Fix it removing explicit separation of charts by rows as redundant.
It is redundant because div elements nicely fit any screen width now.

[1] I7bdf4f9366b7c5b9c8f61340bdc96a779c503366

Change-Id: I486c986dc6ae6b98da193c30924d2ae1b159b51c
Closes-Bug: #1578978

commit_message:
fix resource_type tablename for instance_net_int

migration 0735ed97e5b3_add_tablename_to_resource_type.py is incorrectly
setting tablename as 'instance_net_int' (with quotes). this causes
error in future migrations specficially 34c517bcc2dd_shorter_foreign_key.py
where insp.get_foreign_keys("%s_history" % rt.tablename) cannot find
tablename 'instance_net_int'_history

Change-Id: Idf51ef40b1d4fe22d52849ab1402b6c19de5210c
(cherry picked from commit 24ca86b0e20dd0c067fab01729bd40be34523956)

commit_message:
invoke sphinx directly instead of through pbr

The pbr feature for invoking sphinx doesn't let us treat warnings as
errors because of a bug in pbr. Switch to invoking sphinx directly,
including removing the setup.cfg instructions for sphinx, so we can use
the flag to treat warnings as errors. Doing this also requires fixing a
few existing warnings, so those changes are included in this patch.

Change-Id: I2aa0d844855d5a18646d0bc3907620544ae71be2
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
OVS: Add mac spoofing filtering to flows

The mac-spoofing filtering done by iptables was
not adequate. See the bug report and change
I39dc0e23fc118ede19ef2d986b29fc5a8e48ff78 for
more information.

This patch adds flows to the OVS agent to block
any traffic from the VM that isn't in the allowed
address pairs macs or the mac address field of
the port.

Conflicts:
    This had to be heavily modified to work with Kilo due to
    the lack of a pluggable openflow interface that was present
    in master, mitaka, and liberty.

Closes-Bug: #1558658
Change-Id: I02984b21872e0f183db7404c10d8180dbd89075f
(cherry-picked from 997d7b03fb7f5528f0a3ce70867b9dcd9321509e)

subject: Fix: wizard action cancellation keeps button disabled
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-10 16:39:49.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/actions/edit.action.service.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/modal/wizard-modal.service.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/modal/wizard.controller.js', 'horizon/static/framework/widgets/modal/wizard.controller.spec.js', 'openstack_dashboard/static/app/core/images/actions/edit.action.service.spec.js'], 'message': "Fix: wizard action cancellation keeps button disabled

Symptom: Canceling a wizard action, then clicking on it again failed to
open the action.

Reason: The Angular wizard did not have a way to communicate back to the
calling context that the window had been canceled.  Following this back,
that meant that the actions directive could not re-enable the button.

Solution: Add a callback, same as the 'submit' configuration, ensuring
that the context can register a callback to be called when the user cancels
the modal action.  Also ensure that ESC closes of the modal are caught
and handled as a cancel.

Testing: Before this fix, verify that going to the Angular Images panel,
if you select Edit Image for an item, then cancel it, then re-select the
Edit Image, you cannot execute the action.  After the fix, verify that
after canceling the action, you can again run it.

Change-Id: I04db57bce831680423a5eb2f57db71e7342d87a2
Closes-Bug: 1580206
"}]
commit_message:
Fix: wizard action cancellation keeps button disabled

Symptom: Canceling a wizard action, then clicking on it again failed to
open the action.

Reason: The Angular wizard did not have a way to communicate back to the
calling context that the window had been canceled.  Following this back,
that meant that the actions directive could not re-enable the button.

Solution: Add a callback, same as the 'submit' configuration, ensuring
that the context can register a callback to be called when the user cancels
the modal action.  Also ensure that ESC closes of the modal are caught
and handled as a cancel.

Testing: Before this fix, verify that going to the Angular Images panel,
if you select Edit Image for an item, then cancel it, then re-select the
Edit Image, you cannot execute the action.  After the fix, verify that
after canceling the action, you can again run it.

Change-Id: I04db57bce831680423a5eb2f57db71e7342d87a2
Closes-Bug: 1580206

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-10 10:28:48.000000000', 'files': ['manila_ui/enabled/_90_manila_project_shares.py', 'manila_ui/exceptions.py'], 'message': 'Register Manilaclient exceptions in Horizon

Add Manilaclient's NotFound exception to 'NOT_FOUND' exception family
in Horizon. Without it we get error 500 from Horizon on pages with
resource tables where something is being deleted and then not found.
Do the same for "recoverable" and "unauthorized" types too.

Also, remove redundant, already registered exceptions related to other
projects from "manila_ui.exceptions" module.

Change-Id: I1dffec243feb12783dceb705ff6191dbcc8b3aa5
Closes-Bug: #1481902
Closes-Bug: #1579114
'}]
commit_message:
Register Manilaclient exceptions in Horizon

Add Manilaclient's NotFound exception to 'NOT_FOUND' exception family
in Horizon. Without it we get error 500 from Horizon on pages with
resource tables where something is being deleted and then not found.
Do the same for "recoverable" and "unauthorized" types too.

Also, remove redundant, already registered exceptions related to other
projects from "manila_ui.exceptions" module.

Change-Id: I1dffec243feb12783dceb705ff6191dbcc8b3aa5
Closes-Bug: #1481902

subject: Fix broken ceilometer resources migration script
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-10 13:01:34.000000000', 'files': ['gnocchi/indexer/alembic/versions/ffc7bbeec0b0_migrate_legacy_resources_to_db2.py'], 'message': "Fix broken ceilometer resources migration script

Migration script 828c16f70cce have a bug, the following command doesn't
insert anything:

    op.execute(resource_type.insert().from_select(
           ['name'], sa.select([resource.c.type]).distinct()))

So all migration scripts that manipulates resource_type next, do not
update upgrade the resource_type for legacy ceilometer resources.

This change fixes that.

Change-Id: I5f8c47721c313eea3936132f3140793ec80ef3b1
(cherry picked from commit 6a5c2714a6d120c75ed65ae8d8d686ae692f7cb7)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix broken ceilometer resources migration script

Migration script 828c16f70cce have a bug, the following command doesn't
insert anything:

    op.execute(resource_type.insert().from_select(
           ['name'], sa.select([resource.c.type]).distinct()))

So all migration scripts that manipulates resource_type next, do not
update upgrade the resource_type for legacy ceilometer resources.

This change fixes that.

Change-Id: I5f8c47721c313eea3936132f3140793ec80ef3b1
(cherry picked from commit 6a5c2714a6d120c75ed65ae8d8d686ae692f7cb7)

commit_message:
Change hashes for latest oslo.versionedobjects

oslo.versionedobjects 1.9.0 was released 2016/05/09, and the unit test
test_versions started failing on the gate because BaseEnumField was
changed on the latest oslo.versiondobjects.

This patch changes the testing hashes of objects which use BaseEnumField
for passing the gate test.

Closes-Bug: #1580008

Change-Id: I6eac844b405293bf5ea3cccc3009fed0d3885a75

subject: Disable resize tests in Tempest if using cells with custom flavors
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-10 13:55:12.000000000', 'files': ['lib/tempest'], 'message': "Disable resize tests in Tempest if using cells with custom flavors

By default, devstack creates it's own test flavors for Tempest runs.

These are not in the cells API database since they are non-default
for nova so any resize tests in Tempest with cells and these custom
flavors fail.

Configure Tempest to not run resize tests if using cells and custom
flavors.

This allows us to also clean up a bunch of the resize skips found
in nova/devstack/tempest-dsvm-cells-rc.

Change-Id: I20f46024e45e32c60275703a193a56ae8cfe7eca
Closes-Bug: #1513925
(cherry picked from commit 6cd616a9edf6561ebc802f3083eb24f2713d4e96)
"}]
commit_message:
Disable resize tests in Tempest if using cells with custom flavors

By default, devstack creates it's own test flavors for Tempest runs.

These are not in the cells API database since they are non-default
for nova so any resize tests in Tempest with cells and these custom
flavors fail.

Configure Tempest to not run resize tests if using cells and custom
flavors.

This allows us to also clean up a bunch of the resize skips found
in nova/devstack/tempest-dsvm-cells-rc.

Change-Id: I20f46024e45e32c60275703a193a56ae8cfe7eca
Closes-Bug: #1513925
(cherry picked from commit 6cd616a9edf6561ebc802f3083eb24f2713d4e96)

(cherry picked from commit c94403d8e6c480dad6d962e517c623e1c14ac6d2)
"}]
commit_message:
Disable compute interface attach Tempest tests if using cells

Cells doesn't support the os-attach-interfaces API so disable those
tests in Tempest if running with Cells.

Change-Id: I5c7884407868eae70ea125f3f893c73214c04c75
(cherry picked from commit c94403d8e6c480dad6d962e517c623e1c14ac6d2)

commit_message:
WIP: Enable Backend Usage Reporting

An API has been created that allows user to query Cinder
and return the amount of free and used storage.
This patch enables that feature in Horizon in its own
panel and table.

The Block Storage panel will be used in future Cinder
use cases where block storage specific features can
be added.

Reference
---------
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/cinder/+spec/backend-usage-reporting
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/301444/

Partially Implements Blueprint: cinder-backend-usage-reporting

Change-Id: I54103cf8c16412849a60e7fef43be3312046f9a6

commit_message:
Use common tempest tox venv and add plugin install variable

This commit adds a new variable to lib/tempest to provide the plugins
that should be installed into common tox venv that gets created. In
order to make this work the workarounds to handle migrating to a common
tox venv have to be removed otherwise the plugins could be installed in
a venv that isn't used. This also removes the constrained installation
steps, as the constraints packaged on mitaka will eventually conflict
with what tempest actually requires since tempest follows master
requirements and constraints.

Change-Id: I63658b8d8dfa999e0feb79f8f2968f2b32e3ff57
Depends-On: Iab2e6e04b6c5795a4d0c8214564106525b942308
(cherry picked from commit 440464ccbbaf33e4687bd9fece5e1de64542f263)

commit_message:
Use common tempest tox venv and add plugin install variable

This commit adds a new variable to lib/tempest to provide the plugins
that should be installed into common tox venv that gets created. In
order to make this work the workarounds to handle migrating to a common
tox venv have to be removed otherwise the plugins could be installed in
a venv that isn't used. This also removes the constrained installation
steps, as the constraints packaged on liberty will eventually conflict
with what tempest actually requires since tempest follows master
requirements and constraints.

Change-Id: I63658b8d8dfa999e0feb79f8f2968f2b32e3ff57
Depends-On: Iab2e6e04b6c5795a4d0c8214564106525b942308
(cherry picked from commit 440464ccbbaf33e4687bd9fece5e1de64542f263)
(cherry picked from commit a47398ffee52f2c6fd5ced4bfb13a38132adb51e)

subject: OpenSwan: handle disconnect properly for multiple subnets
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 105, 'name': 'Kyle Mestery', 'email': 'mestery@mestery.com', 'username': 'mestery'}, {'_account_id': 6659, 'name': 'Paul Michali', 'email': 'pc@michali.net', 'username': 'pcm'}, {'_account_id': 9656, 'name': 'Ihar Hrachyshka', 'email': 'ihrachys@redhat.com', 'username': 'ihrachys', 'status': 'Red Hat Networking Systems Engineer'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-10 23:17:36.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_vpnaas/tests/unit/services/vpn/device_drivers/test_ipsec.py', 'neutron_vpnaas/services/vpn/device_drivers/ipsec.py'], 'message': 'OpenSwan: handle disconnect properly for multiple subnets

When mutiple subnets configured in one connection thru endpoint group.
the connection name suffix shown in ipsec status is not always as 0x1
but something like 08d11cfb-dc15-43e2-aee3-c2c71e6ae8e3/1x1 and 1x2 etc.
In this patch, we get the exact connection names from the status output
and then terminate them one by one in a loop.

Closes-Bug: #1564745
Change-Id: I2fa4eb7a7df1500b628abc31f89491ef61deb464
(cherry picked from commit 19172b3be2482cac22bc37447332fc8b7eb19bcd)
'}]
commit_message:
OpenSwan: handle disconnect properly for multiple subnets

When mutiple subnets configured in one connection thru endpoint group.
the connection name suffix shown in ipsec status is not always as 0x1
but something like 08d11cfb-dc15-43e2-aee3-c2c71e6ae8e3/1x1 and 1x2 etc.
In this patch, we get the exact connection names from the status output
and then terminate them one by one in a loop.

Closes-Bug: #1564745
Change-Id: I2fa4eb7a7df1500b628abc31f89491ef61deb464
(cherry picked from commit 19172b3be2482cac22bc37447332fc8b7eb19bcd)

commit_message:
Merge tag '8.1.0'

This is a null-merge of the 8.1.0 release tag back into the master
branch so that the 8.1.0 tag will appear in the git commit history of
the master branch. It contains no actual changes to the master branch,
regardless of how our code review system's UI represents it. Please
ask in #openstack-infra if you have any questions, and otherwise try
to merge this as quickly as possible to avoid later conflicts on the
master branch.

Change-Id: I7572ecaca2d0d038f9205980faa3da948f2d501c

commit_message:
FWaaS quota registration

Builds on prior attempts to register FWaaS resources to the quota
engine, such as commit Ia4d6b9a65acd1111a050dc73b63a1f0ce619cb55
which had to be reverted for bug 1513280 for failing gate via commit
28948f6559711a0d861fa76f3adf65cda22768fb.

Since with router insertion a user can have a separate firewall
and policy per targeted router in their tenant, the original
fixes which had defaults of only 1 were too low.

Also added the release notes to reflect the quota.

Set default as -1 (unlimited) in Liberty to avoid breaking
compatibility.

Change-Id: I68a5538f7bc8df78212633c73eeca0eaae0d8455
Closes-Bug: #1399280

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 5202, 'name': 'Erno Kuvaja', 'email': 'jokke@usr.fi', 'username': 'jokke'}, {'_account_id': 5314, 'name': 'Brian Rosmaita', 'email': 'rosmaita.fossdev@gmail.com', 'username': 'brian-rosmaita'}, {'_account_id': 12000, 'name': 'Ian Cordasco', 'email': 'sigmavirus24@gmail.com', 'username': 'sigmavirus24'}, {'_account_id': 14676, 'name': 'Kairat Kushaev', 'email': 'kkushaev@mirantis.com', 'username': 'kairat_kushaev'}, {'_account_id': 17116, 'name': 'Niall Bunting', 'email': 'niall.bunting@hpe.com', 'username': 'NiallBunting'}, {'_account_id': 17130, 'name': 'melissaml', 'email': 'ma.lei@99cloud.net', 'username': 'malei'}, {'_account_id': 18791, 'name': 'Glance Bot', 'email': 'glancebot@mailinator.com', 'username': 'glancebot', 'inactive': True}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-02-02 10:53:51.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/functional/v2/test_images.py', 'glance/api/v2/images.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v2/test_images_resource.py'], 'message': 'Change default sort_dir for images

If user executes "glance image-list" then default sort direction
is asc. That behavior has been implemented in client.
If user executes "glance image-list --sort-key name then default
sort direction is desc because client doesn't this by default
and uses default server behavior (which is desc).
It confuses users who expect the list of images to be printed
in the same ordering as glance image-list.
So it seems reasonable to change default server sort direction
for images in order to provide a consistency between client
and server.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1489941

Change-Id: If3c5e9ec180d02993006e124be44a6c531ffcbcd
'}]
commit_message:
Change default sort_dir for images

If user executes "glance image-list" then default sort direction
is asc. That behavior has been implemented in client.
If user executes "glance image-list --sort-key name then default
sort direction is desc because client doesn't this by default
and uses default server behavior (which is desc).
It confuses users who expect the list of images to be printed
in the same ordering as glance image-list.
So it seems reasonable to change default server sort direction
for images in order to provide a consistency between client
and server.

APIImpact
Closes-Bug: #1489941

Change-Id: If3c5e9ec180d02993006e124be44a6c531ffcbcd

Simplify README to redirect to the main documentation

During OpenStack Summit in Austin, we wanted to simplify the README
files so they would be consistent and redirect to a single place for doc:
http://docs.openstack.org/developer/puppet-openstack-guide/

Change-Id: I08f1fa6268290575f1b326be412fa1561bdf953d

revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2016-05-04 13:31:14.000000000', 'files': ['specs/newton/approved/efficacy-indicator.rst', 'specs/mitaka/approved/efficacy-indicator.rst', 'doc/source/images/class_diagram_efficacy_indicator.png', 'doc/source/image_src/plantuml/class_diagram_efficacy_indicator.txt'], 'message': 'Provide efficacy indicators

When the admin trigger an audit using Watcher, we provide a list of
actions that should be run to attain a specific goal (defined in the
audit template), Today, there is no incentive to give a predicted
result of the optimization after running the actions plan. This
feature will give the admin an estimated gain of running Watcher

Implements: blueprint bp/efficacy-indicator
'}]
commit_message:
Provide efficacy indicators

When the admin trigger an audit using Watcher, we provide a list of
actions that should be run to attain a specific goal (defined in the
audit template), Today, there is no incentive to give a predicted
result of the optimization after running the actions plan. This
feature will give the admin an estimated gain of running Watcher
on the infrastructure.

Change-Id: I774b6bde9329135d7cb9c85387ea40f9ab59d49f
Implements: blueprint bp/efficacy-indicator

subject: Use uuid instead of time as path for test data
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-06 15:54:17.000000000', 'files': ['freezer/tests/freezer_tempest_plugin/tests/api/test_swift_backup.py', 'freezer/tests/freezer_tempest_plugin/tests/api/test_fs_backup.py'], 'message': 'Use uuid instead of time as path for test data

The previous approach used the current time in seconds. This
sometimes failed because tempest runs the test in parallel,
so they overwrote each others test data.

Change-Id: I8e5341306bc0252e932f158e1271eb72d1e326e1
'}]
commit_message:
Use uuid instead of time as path for test data

The previous approach used the current time in seconds. This
sometimes failed because tempest runs the test in parallel,
so they overwrote each others test data.

Change-Id: I8e5341306bc0252e932f158e1271eb72d1e326e1

commit_message:
Add support for the oslo db_max_retries parameter

The db_max_retries parameter regulates the number of reconnection
attempts performed after an error raised rather than at startup.

Change-Id: If29c9758aa901ccf836934f88c61ccb1f09205c1
Closes-Bug: 1579718

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-05 13:15:26.000000000', 'files': ['static/tests/functional/nightly/test_equipment_page.js', 'static/tests/functional/nightly/test_network_settings.js', 'static/tests/functional/nightly/library/equipment.js', 'static/tests/functional/nightly/test_network_groups.js', 'static/tests/functional/nightly/library/nodes.js', 'static/tests/functional/nightly/library/networks.js', 'static/tests/functional/nightly/test_node_roles.js'], 'message': 'Updates and new "nightly" functional ui tests for fuel-ui.
Merged to one review for more convenience.

Some minor updates for existing libs and test-suites.

New tests for "View of all nodes across environments" test group:
  Check management and public ip fields at unallocated and undeployed node details pop-up
  Check management and public ip fields at node details pop-up after deployment starts

New "Node roles panel" test group:
  Check new node role list takes up less space on a screen
  Check new visual design for different role statuses
  Check "Indeterminate" visual design for role statuses
  Check node roles grouping by new meta attribute "group"
  Check role data (name, description) observed correctly
  Check warning popover message for different variants of node roles intersections

New "Show all node network groups" test group:
  Check that "Show All Networks" checkbox appears after new network group creation
  Check that "Show All Networks" checkbox disappears after new network group deletion
  Check that "Show All Networks" checkbox worked as expected
  Check that selected "Show All Networks" checkbox disappears after new network group deletion
  Check that by default "Show All Networks" checkbox is not selected
  Check that user returns to merged "All Networks" segment after refreshing of page
  Check that user returns to merged "All Networks" segment after switching between cluster tabs
  Check that selected "Show All Networks" checkbox is selected after switching between "Networks" segments
  Check that user can add and rename new node network group at merged "All Networks" segment
  Check that user can add and rename new node network group at merged "All Networks" segment after deployment
  Check that new node network groups are added to the end of the merged "All Networks" segment
  Check correct deletion of new node network group from merged "All Networks" segment
  Check that changed settings are saved at merged "All Networks" segment

Change-Id: If9f88fa4cdafb67415fc4e4b265933944b3ed261
'}]
commit_message:
Updates and new "nightly" functional ui tests for fuel-ui.
Merged to one review for more convenience.

Some minor updates for existing libs and test-suites.

New tests for "View of all nodes across environments" test group:
  Check management and public ip fields at unallocated and undeployed node details pop-up
  Check management and public ip fields at node details pop-up after deployment starts

New "Node roles panel" test group:
  Check new node role list takes up less space on a screen
  Check new visual design for different role statuses
  Check "Indeterminate" visual design for role statuses
  Check node roles grouping by new meta attribute "group"
  Check role data (name, description) observed correctly
  Check warning popover message for different variants of node roles intersections

New "Show all node network groups" test group:
  Check that "Show All Networks" checkbox appears after new network group creation
  Check that "Show All Networks" checkbox disappears after new network group deletion
  Check that "Show All Networks" checkbox worked as expected
  Check that selected "Show All Networks" checkbox disappears after new network group deletion
  Check that by default "Show All Networks" checkbox is not selected
  Check that user returns to merged "All Networks" segment after refreshing of page
  Check that user returns to merged "All Networks" segment after switching between cluster tabs
  Check that selected "Show All Networks" checkbox is selected after switching between "Networks" segments
  Check that user can add and rename new node network group at merged "All Networks" segment
  Check that user can add and rename new node network group at merged "All Networks" segment after deployment
  Check that new node network groups are added to the end of the merged "All Networks" segment
  Check correct deletion of new node network group from merged "All Networks" segment
  Check that changed settings are saved at merged "All Networks" segment

Change-Id: If9f88fa4cdafb67415fc4e4b265933944b3ed261

Check that cached file is symlink

commit_message:
Remove unused sqlite_fk in _init_connection_args call

This keyword argument has been moved to be consumed by the SQLite
version of the _init_events() call, and is no longer consumed by an
_init_connection_args() hook.

Change-Id: I5d477cde90fc0c20e0f6c5bc29af34d635502f68

subject: install rabbitmq-server in serial
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-10 08:19:26.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/rabbitmq-install.yml'], 'message': "install rabbitmq-server in serial

In order to prevent race conditions with nodes joining the cluster
simultaneously when the cluster is first formed, we move the rabbitmq
installation play to be 'serial: 1'. However, when the nodes are being
upgraded, it cannot be done in serial so in this case we set 'serial: 0'

There are some tasks/roles called in this playbook that can still be
run in parallel, so we split out the rabbitmq-server install into a
separate play so that we only serialise the parts that are necessary
to ensure maximum efficiency.

Based on commit: 21c24789019bf1ee85347356fe6c70b0b9045d7c

commit_message:
install rabbitmq-server in serial

In order to prevent race conditions with nodes joining the cluster
simultaneously when the cluster is first formed, we move the rabbitmq
installation play to be 'serial: 1'. However, when the nodes are being
upgraded, it cannot be done in serial so in this case we set 'serial: 0'

There are some tasks/roles called in this playbook that can still be
run in parallel, so we split out the rabbitmq-server install into a
separate play so that we only serialise the parts that are necessary
to ensure maximum efficiency.

Based on commit: 21c24789019bf1ee85347356fe6c70b0b9045d7c

Change-Id: I97cdae27fdce4f400492c2134b6589b55fbc5a61
Fixes-Bug: #1573030

commit_message:
install rabbitmq-server in serial

In order to prevent race conditions with nodes joining the cluster
simultaneously when the cluster is first formed, we move the rabbitmq
installation play to be 'serial: 1'. However, when the nodes are being
upgraded, it cannot be done in serial so in this case we set 'serial: 0'

There are some tasks/roles called in this playbook that can still be
run in parallel, so we split out the rabbitmq-server install into a
separate play so that we only serialise the parts that are necessary
to ensure maximum efficiency.

Change-Id: I97cdae27fdce4f400492c2134b6589b55fbc5a61
Fixes-Bug: #1573030
(cherry picked from commit 21c24789019bf1ee85347356fe6c70b0b9045d7c)

commit_message:
Support both olso.m v4 and v5

Oslo.Messaging v5 made some API changes which broke us in
I5f23e23644e90919cb67f81fc306ee85c5e09974. Update our
code to "detect" this API change, and behave accordingly.

commit_message:
Fixes error when attaching SMB volumes

The SMB volume driver fails to attach a SMB volume.
This happens due to the fact that the SMB volume is
treated as an ISCSI volume.

Stack trace:
http://paste.openstack.org/show/NkLcJulSdYRUXs2a4Vs2/

Change-Id: Ie7cf70c436391e59152f5b717948e7dc4f8ced6d
Closes-Bug: #1574824
(cherry picked from commit 62944096f5007f322768ca4d10b2d936c03ee0d7)

revisions:
[{'number': 26, 'created': '2016-05-05 09:21:27.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/ipam_backend_mixin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/db/db_base_plugin_v2.py', 'neutron/db/ipam_pluggable_backend.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/db/test_ipam_pluggable_backend.py', 'neutron/db/ipam_non_pluggable_backend.py'], 'message': 'Fix prefix delegation deleting addresses for ports

If a network has IPv4 and IPv6(prefix delegated) subnets,
prefix delegation is deleting port's IPv4 address and
not properly updating IPv6 address.

Prefix Delegation(PD) is calling port_update with empty fixed_ip,
for the port with IPv4 and IPv6(PD) subnets. After fixing this,
when _update_ips_for_port is called with new_ips having IPv6 PD subnet,
it is unable to add IPv6 address with new subnet prefix,
as _test_fixed_ips_for_port not returning IPv6 PD subnet.

To fix this, we explicitly add PD subnet to "to_add" list,
so that IPv6 address with new prefix added to PD subnet's port.

Closes-bug: #1509626
Partial-Bug: #1505316
Change-Id: I1162ca7d004461c335b0f6e0a9b5d6dff0a10429
'}]
commit_message:
Fix prefix delegation deleting addresses for ports

If a network has IPv4 and IPv6(prefix delegated) subnets,
prefix delegation is deleting port's IPv4 address and
not properly updating IPv6 address.

Prefix Delegation(PD) is calling port_update with empty fixed_ip,
for the port with IPv4 and IPv6(PD) subnets. After fixing this,
when _update_ips_for_port is called with new_ips having IPv6 PD subnet,
it is unable to add IPv6 address with new subnet prefix,
as _test_fixed_ips_for_port not returning IPv6 PD subnet.

To fix this, we explicitly add PD subnet to "to_add" list,
so that IPv6 address with new prefix added to PD subnet's port.

Closes-bug: #1509626
Partial-Bug: #1505316
Change-Id: I1162ca7d004461c335b0f6e0a9b5d6dff0a10429

commit_message:
Use version-less auth_uri for Murano

Since mitaka release murano supporting unversioned keystone endpoints.
According this, we need to change auth_url to unversioned.

Change-Id: I2bb65d18a4ab4b2e24a13e5dd9f7125e07b8e596
Closes-bug: #1573604

commit_message:
Py3: fix an error when adding two `dict_items`

Fix the following error "TypeError: unsupported operand type(s) for +:
'dict_items' and 'dict_items'" on Python3.

This is the only occurence of this pattern, as far as I can tell.

commit_message:
Resolves metadata field output on rest call to  zone import and export

Earlier on REST API call to zones/tasks/imports or zones/tasks/exports,
metadata field was displayed with no key/val pair.
This patch makes {'total_count : #val'} to be be produced as
output in metadata field on execution of those REST API call.

Closes-Bug: #1532925

Change-Id: I566e370edce5f29aafe793d5fdf7fe2fb7b3a856

commit_message:
Avoid unconditional warnings in nova-consoleauth

With the introduction of oslo_cache, there is no feedback anymore about
whether set()ting a cache item was successful, so we stop generating
warnings about this all the time.

Change-Id: I2ca0cdd3dd30498a23da2ef4f352afd199496862
Partial-Bug: 1572062

subject: Switch on warnerrors and universal wheel
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-10 13:47:20.000000000', 'files': ['setup.cfg'], 'message': 'Switch on warnerrors and universal wheel

The warnerrors boolean option is used to tell Sphinx builders to
treat warnings as errors which will cause sphinx-build to fail if
it encounters warnings. This is generally useful to ensure your
documentation stays clean once you have a good docs build.

since we are python 2 and 3 compatible we should create a
universal wheel distribution.

Change-Id: I2a45596590d20b50abd232e3b070454cc28113ad
'}]
commit_message:
Switch on warnerrors and universal wheel

The warnerrors boolean option is used to tell Sphinx builders to
treat warnings as errors which will cause sphinx-build to fail if
it encounters warnings. This is generally useful to ensure your
documentation stays clean once you have a good docs build.

since we are python 2 and 3 compatible we should create a
universal wheel distribution.

Change-Id: I2a45596590d20b50abd232e3b070454cc28113ad

commit_message:
Implement Ubuntu support on ppc64le

This commit allows the functional tests to pass on ppc64 with
Ubuntu. It uses a dict to map the architecture of the platform to
the appropriate repo url.  One thing to note is that ansible reports
the architecture as ppc64le while the distro uses ppc64el.

Change-Id: I99ce6b6f84b3ddff5486debbb1a26e1ba7d7d17e

commit_message:
Add tripleo::selinux

Adds a class to configure SELinux. The code is taken from
puppet-openstack-cloud:
https://github.com/redhat-cip/puppet-openstack-cloud

This allows to share the same code for usage by both the Undercloud and
Overcloud.

Co-Authored By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Co-Authored By: Yanis Guenane <yguenane@redhat.com>

blueprint undercloud-elements
Change-Id: If214005df733d41c2fa4e197df247d8a14baaa14

Add support for the oslo db_max_retries option

The db_max_retries parameter regulates the number of reconnection
attempts performed after an error raised rather than at startup.

subject: install rabbitmq-server in serial
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2016-05-06 14:09:39.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test-install-rabbitmq-server.yml', 'tests/test.yml', 'tests/test-functional.yml', 'tests/test-vars.yml'], 'message': "install rabbitmq-server in serial

In order to prevent race conditions with nodes joining the cluster
simultaneously when the cluster is first formed, we move the rabbitmq
installation play to be 'serial: 1'. However, when the nodes are being
upgraded, it cannot be done in serial so in this case we set 'serial: 0'

The tests are removed from a post_task include in the install play, and
moved to their own play as they need to be run after the entire cluster
has been formed. As well as moving a few generic vars into the
test-vars.yml include, we also pass in the specific version of rabbitmq
to be tested against in the test play.

Fixes-Bug: #1573030

Change-Id: Id119ff9f20ddfd8e1f29598c8c5ce862d2e7fab4
"}]
commit_message:
install rabbitmq-server in serial

In order to prevent race conditions with nodes joining the cluster
simultaneously when the cluster is first formed, we move the rabbitmq
installation play to be 'serial: 1'. However, when the nodes are being
upgraded, it cannot be done in serial so in this case we set 'serial: 0'

The tests are removed from a post_task include in the install play, and
moved to their own play as they need to be run after the entire cluster
has been formed. As well as moving a few generic vars into the
test-vars.yml include, we also pass in the specific version of rabbitmq
to be tested against in the test play.

Fixes-Bug: #1573030

Change-Id: Id119ff9f20ddfd8e1f29598c8c5ce862d2e7fab4

'}]
commit_message:
Give ironic grenade jobs 7 "nodes" running tinyipa

This moves ironic's grenade job to tinyipa, which only requires 384MB of
RAM, and thus we can fit 7 of them in a run.

This (hopefully) should be enough capacity to get us through the tempest
runs that grenade does.

Change-Id: I79f319e9fdba3bd69d9117f63373b18b195ff9ca

commit_message:
Mention of the supported locales in the documentation

We current only support en_US.UTF-8 at the moment in openstack-ansible.
While people can try other locales, we should tell in the documentation
that it's not supported.

This commit explains that.

We could extend the documentation when proper testing of different
locales will be implemented.

Closes-Bug: #1572859
Change-Id: I97ca85174a3ab203f25f96104d97ef139f3011d6
(cherry picked from commit 9a2df7cf879b539f466536cf834fd02e969d99ae)

commit_message:
Add support for db_max_retries param

The db_max_retries parameter regulates the number of reconnection
attempts performed after an error raised rather than at startup.

Change-Id: Ie4f94a07c6e6e9fdddd8c048447e493abb3ebd48
Closes-Bug: 1579718

commit_message:
Fix scheduling with instance properties

Currently, the scheduler will ignore any properties
that are specific to the share instance. This is because
they are not passed into the scheduler filters as part of
the resource properties.

Change-Id: I8c3274e4d2779562dd8ee529473dd7cad521dbee
Closes-Bug: #1515624
(cherry picked from commit 41e0b0949197786292d474c960693243bebbca07)

commit_message:
Configure default_dns variable

default_dns variable in murano.conf/networking was not configured
during DevStack installation. This was the reason for fails during
deployment if murano-agent was not installed or detected properly.

Change-Id: Iefdcc01b33e63f39943bc5ed1276f8b4b87293b1

commit_message:
"vbmc list" to sort the result by domain name

This patch is making the result of "vbmc list" command to sort the table
by the domain name, that's visually easier to follow.

This patch also makes use of the PrettyTable's get_string() method when
printing a table for the "list" and "show" commands.

Change-Id: I6bd6d0d9f5a9d2eeaa791d1e9d56bb3dc4131da2

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6598, 'name': 'Berezovsky Irena', 'email': 'irenab.dev@gmail.com', 'username': 'irenab'}, {'_account_id': 9820, 'name': 'Liping Mao', 'email': 'limao@cisco.com', 'username': 'LipingMao'}, {'_account_id': 11343, 'name': 'Gal Sagie', 'email': 'gal.sagie@gmail.com', 'username': 'GalSagie'}, {'_account_id': 12069, 'name': 'Taku Fukushima', 'email': 'f.tac.mac@gmail.com', 'username': 'tfukushima'}, {'_account_id': 14352, 'name': 'Antoni Segura Puimedon', 'email': 'celebdor@gmail.com', 'username': 'toni'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-10 12:18:26.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr/controllers.py'], 'message': 'Adding support for two new libnetwork methods

In Docker 1.11 support for the two newly added
libnetwork methods is not required. However, not
having these supported result in errors that may
be confusing to users.

These two methods are to make support for exported
and published ports on a per container basis as discussed
here: https://github.com/docker/libnetwork/issues/992
It is proposed that by Docker version 1.12 support
for these methods become mandatory.

Support for exposed port will be added in a separate patchset.
Support for publishing port may be added later on when
needed support in Neutron is available.

Change-Id: Idf69a094eda2141cfa25b79d3095010871e1c9e8
'}]
commit_message:
Adding support for two new libnetwork methods

In Docker 1.11 support for the two newly added
libnetwork methods is not required. However, not
having these supported result in errors that may
be confusing to users.

These two methods are to make support for exported
and published ports on a per container basis as discussed
here: https://github.com/docker/libnetwork/issues/992
It is proposed that by Docker version 1.12 support
for these methods become mandatory.

Support for exposed port will be added in a separate patchset.
Support for publishing port may be added later on when
needed support in Neutron is available.

Change-Id: Idf69a094eda2141cfa25b79d3095010871e1c9e8

commit_message:
Ensure API workers > 1 starts correctly

* Switch WSGIService to using the bind_tcp method
* Add support for TCP_KEEPIDLE to the bind_tcp method

Closes-Bug: 1498054

subject: Skip validation of identical resources
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-21 08:09:53.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/stack.py'], 'message': 'Skip validation of identical resources

Compare resources and check if their resource
definitions diff. And than validate only ones
with unique properties. That saves time by
skipping excessive validation.

Implements: blueprint skip-excessive-validation-in-nested-resource-group

Co-Authored-By: Oleksii Chuprykov <ochuprykov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I93dd4b72200f8b90eb8f8f9907eeb54f7ec2dc2d
'}]
commit_message:
Skip validation of identical resources

Compare resources and check if their resource
definitions diff. And than validate only ones
with unique properties. That saves time by
skipping excessive validation.

Implements: blueprint skip-excessive-validation-in-nested-resource-group

Co-Authored-By: Oleksii Chuprykov <ochuprykov@mirantis.com>

Change-Id: I93dd4b72200f8b90eb8f8f9907eeb54f7ec2dc2d

commit_message:
Replace usages of _.pluck by _.map

In order to make possible an upgrade of Lodash package
to the latest 4.x version, usages of _.pluck should be replaced by _.map.
_.pluck is deprecated in the 4.x Lodash.

Change-Id: I080ff817049d69f4cd4365c42f5a171da74125aa

This message is repeated for certain macs in log. These are the ports
in the host environent, but not managed by neutron. Instead of printing
these lines as info, convert them to debug to avoid filling up of log
and run out of space.

Closes-Bug: #1570833
'}]
commit_message:
"No ports have port-id <mac> found" in neutron server log

This message is repeated for certain macs in log. These are the ports
in the host environent, but not managed by neutron. Instead of printing
these lines as info, convert them to debug to avoid filling up of log
and run out of space.

Change-Id: I35ca52de6171881f6262ee2e43911863f9e7c40d
Closes-Bug: #1570833

commit_message:
Explicitly set queue settings (ceilometer)

Upstream puppet modules switched to
puppet-oslo usage, but they also changed
defaults. This caused unwanted changes
in behavior. Related bug is mentioned
below. This patch "restores" previous
values of message queue parameters.

Related-bug: #1573592

Change-Id: Ica2d3779394c47e148aeb8927b53d72625e35229

commit_message:
Fix 20 typos on devref

specifiy    => specify
mulit-part  => multi-part
analagous   => analogous
driver.intialize_connection => driver.initialize_connection
succesfully => successfully
Analagous   => Analogous
responsiblity => responsibility
standaredized => standardized
replciation => replication
speicfied   => specified
desireable  => desirable
occurr      => occur
transfered  => transferred
migraton    => migration
streching   => stretching
Documenation => Documentation

Change-Id: Id531e35457f592cccd963ae8b7d50553c7ffb62d

subject: Maintain ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED constant with deepcopy
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-02 21:17:35.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lib/constants.py'], 'message': 'Maintain ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED constant with deepcopy

ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED needs to always remain the same value, but
deepcopy will instantiate a new object() if it encounters
ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED.  This ensures any deepcopy of a dict that
includes ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED will always return the same instantiation
of object.

Change-Id: I9685dfff24e36992e90919bd7c2be2cda6c075f3
Closes-Bug: #1577571
Co-Authored-By: Kevin Benton <kevin@benton.pub>
'}]
commit_message:
Maintain ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED constant with deepcopy

ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED needs to always remain the same value, but
deepcopy will instantiate a new object() if it encounters
ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED.  This ensures any deepcopy of a dict that
includes ATTR_NOT_SPECIFIED will always return the same instantiation
of object.

Change-Id: I9685dfff24e36992e90919bd7c2be2cda6c075f3
Closes-Bug: #1577571
Co-Authored-By: Kevin Benton <kevin@benton.pub>

subject: StackAction parameter to distinguish top-level create vs. update
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-15 12:41:35.000000000', 'files': ['tripleo_common/tests/test_update.py', 'tripleo_common/update.py'], 'message': 'StackAction parameter to distinguish top-level create vs. update

Previously we tried to use UpdateIdentifier for two different things:
tell whether to perform package update, and also to tell whether the
top-level stack is being created or updated (which was incorrect and
resulted in bug 1567384, and an attempt to work around that bug resulted
in bug 1567385).

We cannot use Heat's "action" conditionals in some cases, because they
refer to the direct parent stack, which can yield undesirable results
when introducing new nested stacks or temporarily no-opping something
and then adding it back (in both these cases, "action" would be
considered "CREATE", even though the top-level stack is in "UPDATE").

Change-Id: I5e7eb522521d985f374db91e7258e5b474b6b2c9
Related-Bug: #1567384
Related-Bug: #1567385
(cherry picked from commit 03eb4b44af7fa30b0edf8ddf58aa330161ea6d54)
'}]
commit_message:
StackAction parameter to distinguish top-level create vs. update

Previously we tried to use UpdateIdentifier for two different things:
tell whether to perform package update, and also to tell whether the
top-level stack is being created or updated (which was incorrect and
resulted in bug 1567384, and an attempt to work around that bug resulted
in bug 1567385).

We cannot use Heat's "action" conditionals in some cases, because they
refer to the direct parent stack, which can yield undesirable results
when introducing new nested stacks or temporarily no-opping something
and then adding it back (in both these cases, "action" would be
considered "CREATE", even though the top-level stack is in "UPDATE").

Change-Id: I5e7eb522521d985f374db91e7258e5b474b6b2c9
Related-Bug: #1567384
Related-Bug: #1567385
(cherry picked from commit 03eb4b44af7fa30b0edf8ddf58aa330161ea6d54)

commit_message:
Run identity v3 only job in ironic

Part of the effort to encourage the v3 identity v3 API usage, it runs
the non-voting identity v3 only job against ironic to ensure it can work
without the keystone v2 api.

Change-Id: I7c123dfd10c154207d5cb3efa265145b3ecffe01

Creates a new job that runs ironic functional tests in a
identity v3-only devstack, and adds this job to the ironic
and ironicclient pipeline.

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-10 09:03:42.000000000', 'files': ['networking_l2gw/tests/unit/db/test_l2gw_db.py', 'networking_l2gw/db/l2gateway/l2gateway_db.py'], 'message': "Return 404 error against invalid id requests

When the update or show l2 gateway api requests specify invalid id,
neutron returns internal server error because _get_l2_gateway method didn't
raises L2GatewayNotFound error.

Closes-Bug: 1535625
"}]
commit_message:
Return 404 error against invalid id requests

When the update or show l2 gateway api requests specify invalid id,
neutron returns internal server error because _get_l2_gateway method didn't
raises L2GatewayNotFound error.
This commit fixes it so that these api can return 404 code error in the
above case.

Change-Id: I561955a972c7419f96db72be85f9538f9e13c3b2
Closes-Bug: 1535625

That's a very rough draft of a possible formalization of the bug
process handling in nova. Nothing's agreed yet, so it's just a
bulleted list of things to consider. Feel free to add feedback.

new things are:
* explicit expiration policy
* clear workflow and status definition

commit_message:
WIP: bug process doc

That's a very rough draft of a possible formalization of the bug
process handling in nova. Nothing's agreed yet, so it's just a
bulleted list of things to consider. Feel free to add feedback.

new things are:
* explicit expiration policy
* clear workflow and status definition
* scope of the (upcoming) nova bugs meeting
* criteria for valid bug reports
* bug skimming duty definition

Change-Id: I953842aa5acf55170808a99d91f8b2aa5a0a938d

commit_message:
keystoneauth for getting nodes

 *  Replace manual implementation of keystone connection
    by standard keystoneauth.session
 *  Remove sphinx dependency: it's not used inside package

PROS: easier to maintain, less code.

Related-Bug: 1542275
Related-Bug: 1558527
Related-Bug: 1564913

Change-Id: I0564fa103c79d6dc36cbfde526876cd32d6a0a01

commit_message:
Add a simple __main__ to easily show healthcheck output

Seems like not many people know what the detailed output
of this thing does, so in order to make it easier to see
that add a simple __main__ entrypoint.

With v3 cloud admin policy file, domain admin can assign
roles to user for projects in his domain. However, he's unable
to list those assignments.

The expectation is that domain admin should be able to

Change-Id: I9e538b845b056d6e6b8b1d8f2f34542073ca854f
Closes-Bug: #1437407

commit_message:
Unable to list role assignments in Project

With v3 cloud admin policy file, domain admin can assign
roles to user for projects in his domain. However, he's unable
to list those assignments.

The expectation is that domain admin should be able to
list role assignments for projects in his own domain.

Change-Id: I9e538b845b056d6e6b8b1d8f2f34542073ca854f
Closes-Bug: #1437407

subject: Ensure we can recover from error during db init
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-09 19:25:54.000000000', 'files': ['unit_tests/test_keystone_hooks.py', 'hooks/keystone_hooks.py'], 'message': 'Ensure we can recover from error during db init

Currently if a failure occurs during the shared-db
hook intialisation sequence after db is inited but
before admin creds have been setup, there is no way
to re-run ensure_admin_credentials. This patch
resolves that issue.

Change-Id: Iad80a0eeae6f94dc89ff994f8e5794c60c272e16
Closes-Bug: 1578351
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure we can recover from error during db init

Currently if a failure occurs during the shared-db
hook intialisation sequence after db is inited but
before admin creds have been setup, there is no way
to re-run ensure_admin_credentials. This patch
resolves that issue.

Change-Id: Iad80a0eeae6f94dc89ff994f8e5794c60c272e16
Closes-Bug: 1578351

commit_message:
Add unittests for the utils.py module

This patch is adding unittests for the utils.py module. The functions
str2bool() and mask_dict_password() are not being unittested because
they should be removed and replaced oslo functions.

revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-04 13:57:18.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py'], 'message': "Add provider_location to cloned volume

Forced backup was failing when the driver returned a 'provider_location'
for a cloned volume, because the return value for create_cloned_volume()
was ignored in _create_temp_cloned_volume().

Change-Id: I709996316e4c212243629e461d36da4152e995e4
Closes-Bug: 1573126
"}]
commit_message:
Add provider_location to cloned volume

Forced backup was failing when the driver returned a 'provider_location'
for a cloned volume, because the return value for create_cloned_volume()
was ignored in _create_temp_cloned_volume().

Change-Id: I709996316e4c212243629e461d36da4152e995e4
Closes-Bug: 1573126

commit_message:
Add _member_ role to Swift operator list

Newly created users unable to interract with Swift by default,
to fix this, we need to add _member_ role to Swift operator list.

Change-Id: Ia4a2ab35efa0e4304b9aba39d59c643848aa123e

The minimum os-win version for Mitaka should be 0.4.1, it contains
a fix necessary for some live migration scenarios.

In the Newton cycle, os-win releases will start from 1.0.0, and
might include changes incompatible with Mitaka. Thus, an upper

Change-Id: I89024b7e997b8c27e82d1085360276a726ea2adf
'}]
commit_message:
Updates os-win requirement

The minimum os-win version for Mitaka should be 0.4.1, it contains
a fix necessary for some live migration scenarios.

In the Newton cycle, os-win releases will start from 1.0.0, and
might include changes incompatible with Mitaka. Thus, an upper
limit for os-win is needed.

Related-Bug: #1562982

Change-Id: I89024b7e997b8c27e82d1085360276a726ea2adf

commit_message:
Make default live_migration_downtime longer

At the summit, a timeout of 1 sec seems to be a common operator choice
to help ensure their live-migration operations complete. Lets help all
users by moving to this default value.

Change-Id: Ic2048f4f51caf4c52fc5de9de579347145f4b86c

subject: Isolate Ansible bootstrap from repo servers
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-09 21:31:53.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh'], 'message': "Isolate Ansible bootstrap from repo servers

On first deployment bootstrap-ansible.sh pulls its packages from PyPI.
On upgrade, when the deployment host is shared with a controller, a
pip.conf file exists to restrict pip to the packages hosted by the repo
containers. This causes bootstrap-ansible.sh to fail when the repo
server created by the previous version does not contain a compatible
version.

This commit adds the flag '--isolated' to allow the bootstrap process to
bypass the repo server.

To allow the pip command to fall back on using the isolated flag the
code is refactored to determine the version of pip prior to its use.

Change-Id: Ie9834eb55a689d6f74441cc78e34b62be5d82141
(cherry picked from commit 6be15b8dddd765edcb06cfe87d2cc72bc8567d5f)
"}]
commit_message:
Isolate Ansible bootstrap from repo servers

On first deployment bootstrap-ansible.sh pulls its packages from PyPI.
On upgrade, when the deployment host is shared with a controller, a
pip.conf file exists to restrict pip to the packages hosted by the repo
containers. This causes bootstrap-ansible.sh to fail when the repo
server created by the previous version does not contain a compatible
version.

This commit adds the flag '--isolated' to allow the bootstrap process to
bypass the repo server.

To allow the pip command to fall back on using the isolated flag the
code is refactored to determine the version of pip prior to its use.

Change-Id: Ie9834eb55a689d6f74441cc78e34b62be5d82141
(cherry picked from commit 6be15b8dddd765edcb06cfe87d2cc72bc8567d5f)

Isolate Ansible bootstrap from repo servers

On first deployment bootstrap-ansible.sh pulls its packages from PyPI.
On upgrade, when the deployment host is shared with a controller, a
pip.conf file exists to restrict pip to the packages hosted by the repo

commit_message:
Make "cleanup-containers" script works dynamically

Make cleanup-containers works dynamically. The script
removes the containers and its volumes dynamically based
on label contained in each kolla container, this way is not
needed create a big container and volume lists to be deleted.

http://paste.openstack.org/show/496357/

Closes-Bug: #1579044
Change-Id: Ie0d8a38ba2cf77c8d5da655958407145f4105bec

commit_message:
Skip 2 health checks if no computes w/o DPDK

If environment doesn't contain compute nodes
without DPDK then it's impossible to run instance
and access it over network using default flavor
which doesn't use huge pages for RAM.

Change-Id: Ic6daf95fb7380a4c9355a5a1e5c6a1e45de46f89
Closes-bug: #1567447

If router has no gateway port when metering-agent wants to add
a metering-label-rule method _process_metering_label_rules() fails
with error "cannot concatenate 'str' and 'NoneType' objects"
because there is no check that router has an external gateway port.
This patch adds this check and adds some unit test.

Change-Id: Ic9f626db41bfb6343187742e209402dd7d5232d1
'}]
commit_message:
Add check that external gw port exist when metering-agent adds a rule

If router has no gateway port when metering-agent wants to add
a metering-label-rule method _process_metering_label_rules() fails
with error "cannot concatenate 'str' and 'NoneType' objects"
because there is no check that router has an external gateway port.
This patch adds this check and adds some unit test.

Closes-bug: #1527274
Change-Id: Ic9f626db41bfb6343187742e209402dd7d5232d1

commit_message:
Remove unused parameters

Remove unused parameters from controller, compute and
cinder-storage templates.  Some of these parameters have
been replaced by referencing the EndpointMap - there are
a few places where that conversion still needs to happen
but this will be addressed in a subsequent patch.

Change-Id: Ic1ed1b4c02e0b1c1756b5a45c53843be10c6d5d4
