reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 425, 'name': 'Darren Birkett', 'email': 'darren.birkett@gmail.com', 'username': 'darren-birkett'}, {'_account_id': 538, 'name': 'Major Hayden', 'email': 'major@mhtx.net', 'username': 'rackerhacker'}, {'_account_id': 6816, 'name': 'Jesse Pretorius', 'email': 'jesse@odyssey4.me', 'username': 'jesse-pretorius'}, {'_account_id': 7353, 'name': 'Kevin Carter', 'email': 'kevin@cloudnull.com', 'username': 'cloudnull'}, {'_account_id': 8246, 'name': 'Qiming Teng', 'email': 'tengqm@outlook.com', 'username': 'tengqm'}, {'_account_id': 17068, 'name': 'Jean-Philippe Evrard', 'email': 'openstack@a.spamming.party', 'username': 'evrardjp'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-06 14:12:57.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/rabbitmq-install.yml'], 'message': "install rabbitmq-server in serial

In order to prevent race conditions with nodes joining the cluster
simultaneously when the cluster is first formed, we move the rabbitmq
installation play to be 'serial: 1'. However, when the nodes are being
upgraded, it cannot be done in serial so in this case we set 'serial: 0'

There are some tasks/roles called in this playbook that can still be
run in parallel, so we split out the rabbitmq-server install into a
separate play so that we only serialise the parts that are necessary
to ensure maximum efficiency.

Change-Id: I97cdae27fdce4f400492c2134b6589b55fbc5a61
Fixes-Bug: #1573030
"}]
commit_message:
install rabbitmq-server in serial

In order to prevent race conditions with nodes joining the cluster
simultaneously when the cluster is first formed, we move the rabbitmq
installation play to be 'serial: 1'. However, when the nodes are being
upgraded, it cannot be done in serial so in this case we set 'serial: 0'

There are some tasks/roles called in this playbook that can still be
run in parallel, so we split out the rabbitmq-server install into a
separate play so that we only serialise the parts that are necessary
to ensure maximum efficiency.

Change-Id: I97cdae27fdce4f400492c2134b6589b55fbc5a61
Fixes-Bug: #1573030

commit_message:
Changed 202 for lock/unlock return code to 200. This addresses bug 1449811. 409 was not addressed
due to the compute node is already in that state so no corrective action is required. 404 is already
covered.

Change-Id: I184e23c06d79572b3e546d230c300f62b077a082

commit_message:
Decouple Shotgun project from Fuel

Shotgun now is an independent project and should
be decoupled from fuel. It is also to have independent
release cycle and core and release teams.

without DPDK

subject: Simplify "Instance Count" verbiage
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-09 22:14:51.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/instances/workflows/create_instance.py'], 'message': 'Simplify "Instance Count" verbiage

When launching an instance, having the field "Instance Count" with the
help message of "Number of instances to launch" does not seem very
useful from a users perspective.  Simply naming the field "Number of
Instances" clarifies the purpose of this field and removes the need for
any help message.

Change-Id: If0b0e088bf4d1ba44fd4890c77275eaf182964eb
'}]
commit_message:
Simplify "Instance Count" verbiage

When launching an instance, having the field "Instance Count" with the
help message of "Number of instances to launch" does not seem very
useful from a users perspective.  Simply naming the field "Number of
Instances" clarifies the purpose of this field and removes the need for
any help message.

Change-Id: If0b0e088bf4d1ba44fd4890c77275eaf182964eb

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-10 01:41:41.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/ext/rest_parameters.py', 'api-ref/source/profiles.inc'], 'message': "Improve parameter parsing in api-ref

This patch improves the rest_parameters parsing so that the 'optional'
property can be specified from within the RST file instead of uniformly
from the parameters.yaml file. The reason is that most parameters can be
optional in one place but be mandatory in other places. We should
specify whether a parameter is optional from where it is referenced,
rather than where it is defined (i.e. the yaml file).

Change-Id: I7449362afef8fb276c732d27a03e4dfbb650cd39
"}]
commit_message:
Improve parameter parsing in api-ref

This patch improves the rest_parameters parsing so that the 'optional'
property can be specified from within the RST file instead of uniformly
from the parameters.yaml file. The reason is that most parameters can be
optional in one place but be mandatory in other places. We should
specify whether a parameter is optional from where it is referenced,
rather than where it is defined (i.e. the yaml file).

Change-Id: I7449362afef8fb276c732d27a03e4dfbb650cd39

commit_message:
UEFI - Forbid access to /usr/share/OVMF/OVMF_CODE.fd

Libvirt will use AppArmor for security in some distributions such as
ubuntu. AppArmor profile is manipulated by virt-aa-helper. If user want
to boot in uefi, they need to specify uefi loader path. But currently
nova will only access to /usr/share/OVMF/OVMF_CODE.fd. However libvirt
forbid access to /usr/share before libvirt 1.2.19. Default package for
older os release such as ubuntu trusty didn't fix yet.

This patch add one uefi option for uefi loader path instead of static
code.

Change-Id: I89b5987054bd694faf8cb4def221d32614af0259
Closes-Bug: #1574195

commit_message:
Add neutron_openvswitch_agent to env.d files

This commit adds all nova hosts, network hosts,
and network agent hosts to the inventory group
"neutron_openvswitch_agent".  It also implements
the neutron_openvswitch_agent to the neutron
component_skel.

Implements: blueprint support-openvswitch
Needed-By: Ifdeccb1166944e58a448b4cf08a679a1e67e534d
Change-Id: I971df850c23f4d402f475cc50300f96bee547d46

subject: Fix obscure error message when no template given to OSC
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-02 04:10:52.000000000', 'files': ['heatclient/common/template_utils.py', 'heatclient/tests/unit/test_template_utils.py'], 'message': "Fix obscure error message when no template given to OSC

This is an internal-only fix, as it does not change any external APIs. A
bit of obfuscation was occurring in the
'template_utils.process_template_path' function call. First we try to
retrieve the template from a urllib call. If that fails, then we try to
make a request with the custom request_object function. If the
request_object function failed to retrieve the template as well, it
would report back 'ERROR: None'. I left both of the calls in this
function, but I made the first exception bubble up back to the caller,
since it is more helpful to the user.

The new error message should report back the following when a template
cannot be found:

<urlopen error [Errno 2] No such file or directory:
'/root/python-heatclient/test.yaml'>

Closed Bug: #1570229

Change-Id: I29e19172322c18559aa476744f7ff3530e689bd0
"}]
commit_message:
Fix obscure error message when no template given to OSC

This is an internal-only fix, as it does not change any external APIs. A
bit of obfuscation was occurring in the
'template_utils.process_template_path' function call. First we try to
retrieve the template from a urllib call. If that fails, then we try to
make a request with the custom request_object function. If the
request_object function failed to retrieve the template as well, it
would report back 'ERROR: None'. I left both of the calls in this
function, but I made the first exception bubble up back to the caller,
since it is more helpful to the user.

The new error message should report back the following when a template
cannot be found:

<urlopen error [Errno 2] No such file or directory:
'/root/python-heatclient/test.yaml'>

Closed Bug: #1570229

Change-Id: I29e19172322c18559aa476744f7ff3530e689bd0

commit_message:
Add a handler to process OFPError messages

Currently, OFPError messages are flooding in fullstack.
But this kind of error are captured by ryu controller, not df.
This handler can help debug.

Change-Id: I2a7535daeb5ade1ce6792a943fd2941b71f2909a
Partial-Bug: #1571665

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-09 15:10:06.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/db/firewall/test_firewall_db.py', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/agents/vyatta/vyatta_utils.py', 'neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/services/firewall/agents/l3reference/test_firewall_l3_agent.py', 'neutron_fwaas/extensions/firewallrouterinsertion.py', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/agents/varmour/varmour_router.py', 'neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/services/firewall/agents/vyatta/test_vyatta_utils.py', 'neutron_fwaas/extensions/cisco/csr_firewall_insertion.py', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/drivers/mcafee/ngfw_fwaas.py', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/drivers/mcafee/smc_api.py', 'neutron_fwaas/extensions/firewall.py', 'neutron_fwaas/db/firewall/firewall_db.py', 'neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/services/firewall/drivers/varmour/test_varmour_fwaas.py', 'neutron_fwaas/services/firewall/plugins/cisco/cisco_fwaas_plugin.py', 'neutron_fwaas/tests/unit/services/firewall/agents/varmour/test_varmour_router.py'], 'message': "Using uniform alias for neutron and neutron-lib imports

This patch prefix 'n_' and 'nlib_' to the module alias imported
from neutron and neutron_lib respectively.

'n_' represents that the module belongs to neutron, while
'nlib_' represents that the module belongs to neutron_lib.

Such change will avoid confusion between the modules having similar
names but imported from different repos.

Change-Id: I998d25fffbda104e355281f43535f34c12ee4253
Partial-Bug: #1579496
"}]
commit_message:
Using uniform alias for neutron and neutron-lib imports

This patch prefix 'n_' and 'nlib_' to the module alias imported
from neutron and neutron_lib respectively.

'n_' represents that the module belongs to neutron, while
'nlib_' represents that the module belongs to neutron_lib.

Such change will avoid confusion between the modules having similar
names but imported from different repos.

Change-Id: I998d25fffbda104e355281f43535f34c12ee4253
Partial-Bug: #1579496

from neutron and neutron_lib respectively.

'n_' represents that the module belongs to neutron, while
'nlib_' represents that the module belongs to neutron_lib.

commit_message:
Using uniform alias for neutron/neutron-lib imports

This patch prefix 'n_' and 'nlib_' to the module alias imported
from neutron and neutron_lib respectively.

'n_' represents that the module belongs to neutron, while
'nlib_' represents that the module belongs to neutron_lib.

Such change will avoid confusion between the modules having similar
names but imported from different repos.

Change-Id: Ief23beb9a236eeeccc2f61fe5d91b709a3c77b55
Partial-Bug: #1579496

commit_message:
Add grenade upgrade hooks to stop agent

This adds grenade upgrade hooks so the agent can actually
be stopped during an upgrade.

This is necessary now that vpnaas runs in a devstack plugin
because its agent will now no longer be stopped by the neutron
plugin inside of grenade.

Change-Id: I5271f0ef4f857eb5650612829d352a821416487a
Partial-Bug: #1579235

commit_message:
[python3] byte/string conversions and enable more tests

* webob response body should be bytes not strings
* Add safe_encode/safe_decode from oslo.utils to convert
  things as needed
* use codecs.decode for byte->hex string conversion
* b64encode needs bytes convert when necessary
* fix lots of tests to check for bytes when appropriate
* FakeHttplibSocket's buffer should be a BytesIO object
  for python3
* fix XMLMatches to work better under python3
* jsonutils.load does not work well with byte stream
  from open(), so use loads instead
* ensure input to StringIO is indeed a string

Partially implements blueprint: nova-python3-mitaka

Change-Id: Ibb4fa47cd71d697a4996425b1797ac2f8cc363cd

commit_message:
OVS: Add mac spoofing filtering to flows

The mac-spoofing filtering done by iptables was
not adequate. See the bug report and change
I39dc0e23fc118ede19ef2d986b29fc5a8e48ff78 for
more information.

This patch adds flows to the OVS agent to block
any traffic from the VM that isn't in the allowed
address pairs macs or the mac address field of
the port.

Closes-Bug: #1558658
Change-Id: I02984b21872e0f183db7404c10d8180dbd89075f
(cherry picked from commit 997d7b03fb7f5528f0a3ce70867b9dcd9321509e)

commit_message:
Linux Bridge: Add mac spoofing filtering to ebtables

The current mac-spoofing code in iptables has two issues.
First, it occurs after the address discovery allow rules
(e.g. DHCP), so MAC addresses can be spoofed on discovery
protocols. Second, since it is based on iptables, it
doesn't apply to protocols like STP.

This means a VM could generate one of these types of packets
with a spoofed MAC address to trick switches into learning
that the spoofed MAC now belongs to the VM's port. The impact
of this depends on the configuration of the environment
(e.g. use of L2pop: see the bug report for details).

This patch adds MAC spoofing filtering to the ARP protection
code for Linux bridge based on ebtables. Only traffic sourced
from the MAC address on the port or in the allowed address
pair MACs will be allowed.

This filtering will not be enabled if the port has port
security disabled or if the device_owner starts with 'network:'.

Change-Id: I39dc0e23fc118ede19ef2d986b29fc5a8e48ff78
Partial-Bug: #1558658
(cherry picked from commit be298f8bc35e6d006c7a9361e42755c9d6790e1e)

commit_message:
OVS: Add mac spoofing filtering to flows

The mac-spoofing filtering done by iptables was
not adequate. See the bug report and change
I39dc0e23fc118ede19ef2d986b29fc5a8e48ff78 for
more information.

This patch adds flows to the OVS agent to block
any traffic from the VM that isn't in the allowed
address pairs macs or the mac address field of
the port.

Conflicts:
  neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/openvswitch/agent/openflow/ovs_ofctl/br_int.py
  (no 'dump_flows_for' method so dump_flows had to be used with an additional
   check of the in_port on existing rules)

Closes-Bug: #1558658
Change-Id: I02984b21872e0f183db7404c10d8180dbd89075f
(cherry picked from commit 997d7b03fb7f5528f0a3ce70867b9dcd9321509e)

Linux Bridge: Add mac spoofing filtering to ebtables

The current mac-spoofing code in iptables has two issues.
First, it occurs after the address discovery allow rules
(e.g. DHCP), so MAC addresses can be spoofed on discovery
protocols. Second, since it is based on iptables, it
doesn't apply to protocols like STP.

This means a VM could generate one of these types of packets
with a spoofed MAC address to trick switches into learning
that the spoofed MAC now belongs to the VM's port. The impact
of this depends on the configuration of the environment
(e.g. use of L2pop: see the bug report for details).

This patch adds MAC spoofing filtering to the ARP protection
code for Linux bridge based on ebtables. Only traffic sourced
from the MAC address on the port or in the allowed address
pair MACs will be allowed.

This filtering will not be enabled if the port has port
security disabled or if the device_owner starts with 'network:'.

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-29 15:34:23.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/utils.py', 'test/unit/common/test_utils.py'], 'message': "SwiftLogFormatter will log transaction IDs on INFO level

Previously SwiftLogFormatter would make two checks. One to see if the
transaction id was already in the message field and another check to
make sure the log level wasn't set to info. If either of these was
true, then it would not log the transaction ID in the transaction ID
field.

This commit removes the check for the info log. Now transaction IDs
will be recorded in all cases that have them.

Change-Id: Ic06538ab55a75d298169ae1745671573ee9c09e8
Closes-Bug: #1504344
"}]
commit_message:
SwiftLogFormatter will log transaction IDs on INFO level

Previously SwiftLogFormatter would make two checks. One to see if the
transaction id was already in the message field and another check to
make sure the log level wasn't set to info. If either of these was
true, then it would not log the transaction ID in the transaction ID
field.

This commit removes the check for the info log. Now transaction IDs
will be recorded in all cases that have them.

Change-Id: Ic06538ab55a75d298169ae1745671573ee9c09e8
Closes-Bug: #1504344

commit_message:
Use common tempest tox venv and add plugin install variable

This commit adds a new variable to lib/tempest to provide the plugins
that should be installed into common tox venv that gets created. In
order to make this work the workarounds to handle migrating to a common
tox venv have to be removed otherwise the plugins could be installed in
a venv that isn't used.

Change-Id: I63658b8d8dfa999e0feb79f8f2968f2b32e3ff57
Depends-On: Iab2e6e04b6c5795a4d0c8214564106525b942308

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-04-04 11:00:37.000000000', 'files': ['deployment/puppet/openstack_tasks/manifests/keystone/keystone.pp', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/astute/service_token_off_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/modular/astute/tasks.yaml', 'tests/noop/spec/hosts/keystone/keystone_spec.rb', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/astute/service_token_off.pp', 'deployment/puppet/osnailyfacter/manifests/globals/globals.pp'], 'message': "Upstream keystone module is used now to disable admin token auth

'service_token_off' puppet manifest previously used special 'exec'
resource for disabling admin_token_auth middleware in public/admin/v3
pipelines.

As the special class for this purpose has been created in the upstream
keystone module, the 'exec' resource was replaced by the inclusion of
this class.

Also, the 'disable_keystone_service_token' task and the corresponding
'service_token_off' puppet manifest were removed and all the logic from

commit_message:
Upstream keystone module is used now to disable admin token auth

'service_token_off' puppet manifest previously used special 'exec'
resource for disabling admin_token_auth middleware in public/admin/v3
pipelines.

As the special class for this purpose has been created in the upstream
keystone module, the 'exec' resource was replaced by the inclusion of
this class.

Also, the 'disable_keystone_service_token' task and the corresponding
'service_token_off' puppet manifest were removed and all the logic from
them was moved to the base keystone task.

Change-Id: I42a8274a11f813eafdd0e5906a33a2fd6b737d03
Closes-bug: #1546737

commit_message:
Rename haproxy-status.sh

The file haproxy-status.sh is dropped as-is in /usr/bin, which
is not Debian policy compliant:
1/ There should be no .sh extension in Debian
2/ The name is too generic and should be prefixed with fuel

This patch fixes the above.

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-02-11 15:26:14.000000000', 'files': ['devops/helpers/helpers.py'], 'message': "Fix slave IP address getting

We use a MAC address to match devops and nailgun nodes.
Sometimes the MAC address of the br-fw-admin bridge
on an already deployed environment has been changed
to the OVS interface MAC.
In that cases we couldn't get an IP by a new MAC,
but the old MAC is stored as a part of the name of the node.
Fix changes a mechanism of getting IP address,
for now it'll be obtain from json

Change-Id: Ia25b03bd970a9e8da19c2cb4356552c177fc9244
Closes-Bug:1542275
"}]
commit_message:
Fix slave IP address getting

We use a MAC address to match devops and nailgun nodes.
Sometimes the MAC address of the br-fw-admin bridge
on an already deployed environment has been changed
to the OVS interface MAC.
In that cases we couldn't get an IP by a new MAC,
but the old MAC is stored as a part of the name of the node.
Fix changes a mechanism of getting IP address,
for now it'll be obtain from json

Change-Id: Ia25b03bd970a9e8da19c2cb4356552c177fc9244
Closes-Bug:1542275

commit_message:
Added capitalization to the value for default node group name

Changes the value "default" in the default node group to
"Default" without changing the key.
The templates are changed because the default value is used
for getting the default configuration which now is the value
"Default".

Change-Id: I3af65721595c6c23389a8d9107b41c64401fa5c7
Closes-Bug: 1518281

commit_message:
replace logging with oslo.log

If we use logging lib to initialize a logger, the logger won't be
applied the oslo.log config options.

Also the library oslo.log provides compatibility for log levels.

Change-Id: Ib36fb60b3eaa56413865ee46a20f11c520af7d8c

subject: Fix pre_test_hook fail and sidebar menu fail
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-09 08:36:45.000000000', 'files': ['tools/gate/integration/pre_test_hook.sh', 'openstack_dashboard/test/integration_tests/regions/menus.py'], 'message': "Fix pre_test_hook fail and sidebar menu fail

It fixes two small but important bugs:
- remove apache restart, because it fails pre_test_hook, which fails
  test build (the latter implication was introduced recently in a
  devstack-gate scripts);
- fix sidebar menu item click before prev item was collapsed, because
  in this case menu item won't be expanded (supposedly a result of
  recent update of one of XStatic dependencies).

Change-Id: If463c4c8b16b54f033e2a2ee33ba995ca7844f2b
Closes-Bug: #1573726
(cherry picked from commit 79fcc65491052adf50ffe141997c28b658a0461b)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix pre_test_hook fail and sidebar menu fail

It fixes two small but important bugs:
- remove apache restart, because it fails pre_test_hook, which fails
  test build (the latter implication was introduced recently in a
  devstack-gate scripts);
- fix sidebar menu item click before prev item was collapsed, because
  in this case menu item won't be expanded (supposedly a result of
  recent update of one of XStatic dependencies).

Change-Id: If463c4c8b16b54f033e2a2ee33ba995ca7844f2b
Closes-Bug: #1573726
(cherry picked from commit 79fcc65491052adf50ffe141997c28b658a0461b)

subject: Allow guestagent to use different rabbit params
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-05-06 15:44:23.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/guestagent-override-rabbit-params-eaf20f06fad960c5.yaml', 'manifests/guestagent.pp', 'spec/classes/trove_guestagent_spec.rb'], 'message': "Allow guestagent to use different rabbit params

In some environments, Trove guests will talk to rabbit via a different
gateway or VIP and possibly using a different port. This might be done
for security or separation reasons. This change allows the guestagent's
rabbit host(s) and port information to be different than that from the
main cluster.

Change-Id: I2107edd579073d81496821a8ecf23a3c2039b75d
"}]
commit_message:
Allow guestagent to use different rabbit params

In some environments, Trove guests will talk to rabbit via a different
gateway or VIP and possibly using a different port. This might be done
for security or separation reasons. This change allows the guestagent's
rabbit host(s) and port information to be different than that from the
main cluster.

Change-Id: I2107edd579073d81496821a8ecf23a3c2039b75d

subject: show release highlights
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-20 17:15:21.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/sphinxext.py'], 'message': 'show release highlights

We have supported a "highlights" field for a while, and it used to be
included in the release announcements. Now that we use reno for release
notes and include those in the announcement emails, we have stopped
including the highlights there. This patch shows the highlights on the
release list page instead.

Change-Id: Id37642fb554dd733f2ea4f92816dc507c7651519
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
show release highlights

We have supported a "highlights" field for a while, and it used to be
included in the release announcements. Now that we use reno for release
notes and include those in the announcement emails, we have stopped
including the highlights there. This patch shows the highlights on the
release list page instead.

Change-Id: Id37642fb554dd733f2ea4f92816dc507c7651519
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Domain scoped object should have a domain name
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 3153, 'name': 'Emilien Macchi', 'email': 'emilien@redhat.com', 'username': 'emilienm'}, {'_account_id': 6525, 'name': 'Gilles Dubreuil', 'email': 'gilles@redhat.com', 'username': 'q-1illes-a'}, {'_account_id': 8297, 'name': 'Sofer Athlan-Guyot', 'email': 'sathlang@redhat.com', 'username': 'chem'}, {'_account_id': 9983, 'name': 'Richard Megginson', 'email': 'rmeggins@redhat.com', 'username': 'rmeggins'}, {'_account_id': 13997, 'name': 'SHIGEMATSU Mitsuhiro', 'email': 'shigematsu.mitsuhiro@lab.ntt.co.jp', 'username': 'pshige'}, {'_account_id': 15519, 'name': 'Iury Gregory Melo Ferreira', 'display_name': 'Iury Gregory', 'email': 'iurygregory@gmail.com', 'username': 'iurygregory'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2015-11-18 03:09:31.000000000', 'files': ['specs/kilo/api-v3-support.rst'], 'message': "Domain scoped object should have a domain name

The initial experimental implementation of Keystone V3 - which makes use of domain
scoped projects, users and roles - allowed for a domain not to be specified.

In order to offer backward compatibility as much as possible, a resource name
without a domain was assumed to belong to either the default domain or if the name
was unique among all domains then the domain in question to be used.

Although a noble idea, it turned out this behavior is creating more confusion
than needed. On top of that, the default domain 'Default' for keystone can be
changed.

The recommendation would be to always use a domain name when applied to domain
scoped object and rely or assume on some default or convention.

This can be done into stages:
1. Remove the feature assuming the domain when the resource is unique
2. Deprecate not using a domain name on the long run.

Change-Id: Ib31cc938125430350d9f20f673d117caa02eb6cc
"}]
commit_message:
Domain scoped object should have a domain name

The initial experimental implementation of Keystone V3 - which makes use of domain
scoped projects, users and roles - allowed for a domain not to be specified.

In order to offer backward compatibility as much as possible, a resource name
without a domain was assumed to belong to either the default domain or if the name
was unique among all domains then the domain in question to be used.

Although a noble idea, it turned out this behavior is creating more confusion
than needed. On top of that, the default domain 'Default' for keystone can be
changed.

The recommendation would be to always use a domain name when applied to domain
scoped object and rely or assume on some default or convention.

This can be done into stages:
1. Remove the feature assuming the domain when the resource is unique
2. Deprecate not using a domain name on the long run.

Change-Id: Ib31cc938125430350d9f20f673d117caa02eb6cc

subject: Ensure consistency in mapping field types
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2016-05-06 02:07:35.000000000', 'files': ['searchlight/tests/unit/test_glance_metadefs_plugin.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_nova_server_plugin.py', 'searchlight/tests/unit/test_plugin.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/glance/metadefs.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/nova/__init__.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/glance/__init__.py', 'searchlight/elasticsearch/plugins/nova/servers.py'], 'message': "Ensure consistency in mapping field types

Elasticsearch requires all field types in an index to be consistent
(and it's better for searching, too). ES-2.x actually enforces this
and won't allow mappings to be created. This patch fixes a couple of
fields and adds a unit test to check all plugins in the source tree.

Note that this does change the structure of the 'security_group' field
for nova servers to be a flat string (or array of strings). The other
option would be to rename the field on ports, or make it a nested type
on Ports also. There is a post-search filtering step that attempts to
return results as compatible with the APIs as possible, at least for
the meantime until we have a larger discussion about this problem.

Change-Id: I7de3643bd5507743e01880c1885175faacef47b6
Closes-Bug: #1532010
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure consistency in mapping field types

Elasticsearch requires all field types in an index to be consistent
(and it's better for searching, too). ES-2.x actually enforces this
and won't allow mappings to be created. This patch fixes a couple of
fields and adds a unit test to check all plugins in the source tree.

Note that this does change the structure of the 'security_group' field
for nova servers to be a flat string (or array of strings). The other
option would be to rename the field on ports, or make it a nested type
on Ports also. There is a post-search filtering step that attempts to
return results as compatible with the APIs as possible, at least for
the meantime until we have a larger discussion about this problem.

Change-Id: I7de3643bd5507743e01880c1885175faacef47b6
Closes-Bug: #1532010

commit_message:
Resolve links before using path as block device

If the charm code is passed symlinks to block devices (as is often the
case with newer MAAS substrate versions), resolve links before
attempting to use the block device for storage.

Charmhelpers were updated as well.

Testing done:

- Unit tests pass
- Tests pass
- Multiple Openstack Autopilot deployments pass

Change-Id: If966239502d0752c86e46f3f0aee96f43828aa08
Closes-Bug: 1577408

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-28 19:27:43.000000000', 'files': ['app/js/services/summary.js', 'app/views/directives/subunit-failures.html', 'app/js/directives/subunit-failures.js', 'app/js/directives/subunit-summary.js', 'app/views/directives/subunit-summary.html', 'app/views/home.html', 'app/js/directives/artifact-summary.js'], 'message': "Add service to summarize different artifact types

Currently, the home page has a hard-coded summary panel specifically
for displaying overviews of subunit artifacts, which makes it
impossible to show information on other types of artifacts. This adds
a new 'summaryService' and associated 'artifact-summary' directive
that can dynamically create summary panels depending on artifact type.

Additionally, since the summary service allows many summary panels per
type per named artifact, we can have multiple (priority-ordered)
panels for each artifact. As an example of this, the existing subunit
summary has been split into simpler 'subunit-summary' and
'subunit-errors' panels.

Change-Id: I0d075dfcb86c6aef8c697896d1728e970b62600f
"}]
commit_message:
Add service to summarize different artifact types

Currently, the home page has a hard-coded summary panel specifically
for displaying overviews of subunit artifacts, which makes it
impossible to show information on other types of artifacts. This adds
a new 'summaryService' and associated 'artifact-summary' directive
that can dynamically create summary panels depending on artifact type.

Additionally, since the summary service allows many summary panels per
type per named artifact, we can have multiple (priority-ordered)
panels for each artifact. As an example of this, the existing subunit
summary has been split into simpler 'subunit-summary' and
'subunit-errors' panels.

Change-Id: I0d075dfcb86c6aef8c697896d1728e970b62600f

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-06 23:10:23.000000000', 'files': ['trove/conductor/api.py', 'releasenotes/notes/fix_notification_err_msgs-e52771108633c9cf.yaml'], 'message': 'Notification exceptions not sent back correctly

With the new notification feature added recently, exceptions
that occur on the guest are sent back to the conductor.
Due to a mis-match in the code however, the wrong call is being
issued. The conductor api makes a call to notify_exception
instead of notify_exc_info.

This has been fixed.

Change-Id: Ib2e04bb903c92b4d570913aba2e985db63c45096
Closes-Bug: #1577848
'}]
commit_message:
Notification exceptions not sent back correctly

With the new notification feature added recently, exceptions
that occur on the guest are sent back to the conductor.
Due to a mis-match in the code however, the wrong call is being
issued. The conductor api makes a call to notify_exception
instead of notify_exc_info.

This has been fixed.

Change-Id: Ib2e04bb903c92b4d570913aba2e985db63c45096
Closes-Bug: #1577848

subject: Replacing opencafe requests with requests module
revisions:
[{'number': 12, 'created': '2016-05-09 19:51:48.000000000', 'files': ['syntribos/clients/http/base_http_client.py', 'syntribos/extensions/identity/client.py', 'syntribos/clients/http/client.py', 'syntribos/runner.py'], 'message': 'Replacing opencafe requests with requests module

Added a new python file, where BaseHTTPClient and
request logging has been defined.Removed opencafe-requests dependency
from http/client.py and identity/client.py, instead using the
python requests module. Also, removed the marshalling
initialzers from identity/client.py and have reused the
v2 and v3 data models, so in future if marshalling has to
be added, can be done. Added a default logging functionality
to runner.py as it is the entry point,the log level has be
set by default to critical as is only used when there is a
request exception, thus minimizing additional logs.

Implements: blueprint remove-opencafe-http

Change-Id: I566e9041c388d969a83202304db019d6f8d68323
'}]
commit_message:
Replacing opencafe requests with requests module

Added a new python file, where BaseHTTPClient and
request logging has been defined.Removed opencafe-requests dependency
from http/client.py and identity/client.py, instead using the
python requests module. Also, removed the marshalling
initialzers from identity/client.py and have reused the
v2 and v3 data models, so in future if marshalling has to
be added, can be done. Added a default logging functionality
to runner.py as it is the entry point,the log level has be
set by default to critical as is only used when there is a
request exception, thus minimizing additional logs.

Implements: blueprint remove-opencafe-http

Change-Id: I566e9041c388d969a83202304db019d6f8d68323

subject: Isolate Ansible bootstrap from repo servers
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-09 14:17:23.000000000', 'files': ['scripts/bootstrap-ansible.sh'], 'message': "Isolate Ansible bootstrap from repo servers

On first deployment bootstrap-ansible.sh pulls its packages from PyPI.
On upgrade, when the deployment host is shared with a controller, a
pip.conf file exists to restrict pip to the packages hosted by the repo
containers. This causes bootstrap-ansible.sh to fail when the repo
server created by the previous version does not contain a compatible
version.

This commit adds the flag '--isolated' to allow the bootstrap process to
bypass the repo server.

To allow the pip command to fall back on using the isolated flag the
code is refactored to determine the version of pip prior to its use.

Change-Id: Ie9834eb55a689d6f74441cc78e34b62be5d82141
"}]
commit_message:
Isolate Ansible bootstrap from repo servers

On first deployment bootstrap-ansible.sh pulls its packages from PyPI.
On upgrade, when the deployment host is shared with a controller, a
pip.conf file exists to restrict pip to the packages hosted by the repo
containers. This causes bootstrap-ansible.sh to fail when the repo
server created by the previous version does not contain a compatible
version.

This commit adds the flag '--isolated' to allow the bootstrap process to
bypass the repo server.

To allow the pip command to fall back on using the isolated flag the
code is refactored to determine the version of pip prior to its use.

Change-Id: Ie9834eb55a689d6f74441cc78e34b62be5d82141

As of I83b46e223e85306b0e54f1d19cbbc7f21489e759,
glance_image_delete_timeout and glance_image_delete_poll_interval
have been moved from rally.plugins.openstack.wrappers.glance to
rally.plugins.openstack.scenarios.glance.utils. So, if a module
using the options doesn't import the glance.utils module, we should
add import_opt for the options. Otherwise NoSuchOptError might be
raised when the options are being used.

Closes-Bug: 1579855
Change-Id: Ia05be0997680e2c91dc5d19bc6e36d70c6b07690
"}]
commit_message:
Add import_opt for CONF.benchmark.glance_image_delete_*

As of I83b46e223e85306b0e54f1d19cbbc7f21489e759,
glance_image_delete_timeout and glance_image_delete_poll_interval
have been moved from rally.plugins.openstack.wrappers.glance to
rally.plugins.openstack.scenarios.glance.utils. So, if a module
using the options doesn't import the glance.utils module, we should
add import_opt for the options. Otherwise NoSuchOptError might be
raised when the options are being used.

Closes-Bug: 1579855
Change-Id: Ia05be0997680e2c91dc5d19bc6e36d70c6b07690

commit_message:
Do not delete a network with ports attached to it

If a network has ports attached to it, do not delete the network
instead raise an exception so that user knows about this
condition.

Additionally, during initialization, when networks are deleted,
remove all the ports associated with the network.

This manual cherry picking becuase of split of repos in stable/kilo

Closes-bug: #1573207
cherry picked from Change-Id: Idb72305ac37dfe0c865fe09fbc5ab784d807906d

Change-Id: I06b6866618fa95aa88b6a079573d32ae3c71ac73

commit_message:
Remove kilo tempest jobs

With the kilo branch going EOL [1][2] we no longer need to run these
jobs on tempest to ensure things still work on the now defunct kilo
branch. This commit removes all the jobs using kilo from tempest.

[1] http://releases.openstack.org/
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2016-May/093914.html

Change-Id: I9a42e1a82c98142fb306911e3611ce12703fc4c0

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4328, 'name': 'Steven Hardy', 'email': 'steven.hardy@suse.com', 'username': 'shardy'}, {'_account_id': 7144, 'name': 'James Slagle', 'email': 'jslagle@redhat.com', 'username': 'slagle'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-04-23 09:26:13.000000000', 'files': ['network/config/bond-with-vlans/controller-no-external.yaml'], 'message': "Fix controller-no-external.yaml in bonded configs.

For some reason the controller-no-external.yaml template is configured
for DHCP on the control plane interface. We switched to static control
plane IPs before the controller-no-external.yaml was created (IIRC), so
I'm not sure how that happened. This change brings the
controller-no-external.yaml in line with the rest of the bonded NIC
templates.

Closes-Bug: #1573943
Change-Id: I2ac929e241707db72a0beabf9d5cd7fc14b90f76
(cherry picked from commit 6d27813db3ce06b4352ac42c3e45887030094c39)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix controller-no-external.yaml in bonded configs.

For some reason the controller-no-external.yaml template is configured
for DHCP on the control plane interface. We switched to static control
plane IPs before the controller-no-external.yaml was created (IIRC), so
I'm not sure how that happened. This change brings the
controller-no-external.yaml in line with the rest of the bonded NIC
templates.

Closes-Bug: #1573943
Change-Id: I2ac929e241707db72a0beabf9d5cd7fc14b90f76
(cherry picked from commit 6d27813db3ce06b4352ac42c3e45887030094c39)

This fixes a defect where a locally cached image is not
always used by the Copy Offload feature. By using an available
image, local to the same backend as the share, performance can be
improved as a clone operation is executed instead of a remote copy.

Also, moved and refactored tests from test_netapp_nfs.py to the
correct test class under the netapp driver test directory. This is
part of the ongoing refactoring of test_netapp_nfs.py to meet
current code standards.

Change-Id: Ia4d4435d81d2f7dabd12582553b89f9b9d5ab38a
Closes-Bug: 1568998
'}]
commit_message:
NetApp: Use Local Cache to Copy an Available Image

This fixes a defect where a locally cached image is not
always used by the Copy Offload feature. By using an available
image, local to the same backend as the share, performance can be
improved as a clone operation is executed instead of a remote copy.

Also, moved and refactored tests from test_netapp_nfs.py to the
correct test class under the netapp driver test directory. This is
part of the ongoing refactoring of test_netapp_nfs.py to meet
current code standards.

Change-Id: Ia4d4435d81d2f7dabd12582553b89f9b9d5ab38a
Closes-Bug: 1568998

commit_message:
neutron: new 8.1.0 mitaka release

Using 8.1.0 instead of 8.0.1 to reflect the fact that there are some
changes that could require special attention from consumers (f.e.
new router ALLOCATING status added; the number of greenlets used by
neutron-server changed).

Change-Id: I9044eb5f06def3339333b70a755b14538dc9bab7

commit_message:
DNM!!! Let's see what breaks when neutron-debug isn't called

It's not clear what the probe ports created by neutron-debug
are actually used for, so let's see what breaks if we don't
have them.

Change-Id: I7b11e6264bebeae3665ed195539e10e837ced1d8
Signed-off-by: RYAN D. MOATS <rmoats@us.ibm.com>

commit_message:
acceptance: ignore CLI warnings

Relax beaker CLI tests so we tolerate warnings like:
"Ignoring domain related configs because identity API version is 2.0"

The warnings are present in aggregate & flavor tests.

Change-Id: I1376322147a66a817f52e3cf94f6043e37e799a3

the endpoints, users and roles of the services in keystone via
puppet.

subject: Add a deliverable for puppet-tripleo
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-06 11:41:40.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/_independent/puppet-tripleo.yaml'], 'message': "Add a deliverable for puppet-tripleo

Add a deliverable and an initial release (we've never yet tagged one)
for puppet-tripleo.

Note this is going under _independent for now, but we intend on doing
coordinated releases for all tripleo components for each milestone
during the newton cycle ref https://review.openstack.org/#/c/308236/
this is just an initial release that's required for downstream packages
to consume, future releases will be actual newton deliverables.

The hash chosen is based on the most recent current-tripleo delorean,
which is based on our most recent periodic CI job promotion.

Change-Id: I44b0ab5571ac3761c92c49f6ad0ebbb73dec2f71
"}]
commit_message:
Add a deliverable for puppet-tripleo

Add a deliverable and an initial release (we've never yet tagged one)
for puppet-tripleo.

Note this is going under _independent for now, but we intend on doing
coordinated releases for all tripleo components for each milestone
during the newton cycle ref https://review.openstack.org/#/c/308236/
this is just an initial release that's required for downstream packages
to consume, future releases will be actual newton deliverables.

The hash chosen is based on the most recent current-tripleo delorean,
which is based on our most recent periodic CI job promotion.

Change-Id: I44b0ab5571ac3761c92c49f6ad0ebbb73dec2f71

subject: [Trivial] Remove executable privilege of setup.py
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-05-09 16:38:37.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_releases/cmds/validate.py', 'setup.py'], 'message': "[Trivial] Remove executable privilege of setup.py

This file actually is not required to be executable.

And openstack_releases/cmds/validate.py is a module rather than
a script, it has main entry but will only used by
`validate-request`, hence doesn't need to be executable as well.

Change-Id: I8791728b296eef1ba60b064fa3a643e839665b1c
"}]
commit_message:
[Trivial] Remove executable privilege of setup.py

This file actually is not required to be executable.

And openstack_releases/cmds/validate.py is a module rather than
a script, it has main entry but will only used by
`validate-request`, hence doesn't need to be executable as well.

Change-Id: I8791728b296eef1ba60b064fa3a643e839665b1c

commit_message:
Add installguide-cookiecutter repo

Add a new repository to make it easy for new projects to write Install
Guides as discussed in the Newton Install Guide design session.

This repo is owned by the docs team. We will start with an empty
repository without any jobs setup for this.

implements bp project-specific-installguides

Needed-By: I7714905263913ac4ad6ce76fca86c57be367f531
Change-Id: Id3db386827b0b807ba773e972b050db98f28dbe9

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-06 01:30:07.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/manager.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/pure.py', 'cinder/volume/driver.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/solidfire.py', 'cinder/volume/driver_utils.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_volume.py', 'cinder/tests/unit/test_pure.py'], 'message': 'Move initiator_data access to helper methods

This changes the flow for how a driver would access the initiator_data
information. Previously it was passed in at initialize_connection
and then a update dictionary merged in with the return of that method.
We will now just have drivers call helper util methods that can get
and set the data.

There are a few benefits of doing this:

* Drivers can synchronize access to the data, if they need to. It won’t
force any locks are anything on someone who doesn’t care. Future
iterations will make this do a conditional update so drivers won’t need
to use locks around it either.
* No more optional params on initialize_connection, meaning all drivers
have the same signature again.
* Less junk in the manager.
* Less db calls for everyone!

Change-Id: I9b90fafdbf290c7d7141b6ce4f83711f0fcd528f
Closes-Bug: #1578801
Closes-Bug: #1578864'}]
commit_message:
Move initiator_data access to helper methods

This changes the flow for how a driver would access the initiator_data
information. Previously it was passed in at initialize_connection
and then a update dictionary merged in with the return of that method.
We will now just have drivers call helper util methods that can get
and set the data.

There are a few benefits of doing this:

* Drivers can synchronize access to the data, if they need to. It won’t
force any locks are anything on someone who doesn’t care. Future
iterations will make this do a conditional update so drivers won’t need
to use locks around it either.
* No more optional params on initialize_connection, meaning all drivers
have the same signature again.
* Less junk in the manager.
* Less db calls for everyone!

Change-Id: I9b90fafdbf290c7d7141b6ce4f83711f0fcd528f
Closes-Bug: #1578801
Closes-Bug: #1578864

subject: Fix wsgi_user and wsgi_group in Red Hat platforms
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-09 14:13:17.000000000', 'files': ['manifests/wsgi/apache.pp', 'manifests/params.pp', 'spec/classes/horizon_wsgi_apache_spec.rb'], 'message': "Fix wsgi_user and wsgi_group in Red Hat platforms

Commit da0cedce6f14f5c35e733ac345d8d862db11cd2b assumed that the
user and group for Horizon in Red Hat platforms was 'dashboard', due
to the following lines being present in openstack-dashboard.conf:

WSGIDaemonProcess dashboard
WSGIProcessGroup dashboard

Actually, based on [1], this does not mean that, and the RPM packages
do not create such user, so we should switch that to the apache user.

[1] http://modwsgi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/configuration-directives/WSGIDaemonProcess.html

Change-Id: I52766ac0521951cc8c857e51a61823410585bed5
"}]
commit_message:
Fix wsgi_user and wsgi_group in Red Hat platforms

Commit da0cedce6f14f5c35e733ac345d8d862db11cd2b assumed that the
user and group for Horizon in Red Hat platforms was 'dashboard', due
to the following lines being present in openstack-dashboard.conf:

WSGIDaemonProcess dashboard
WSGIProcessGroup dashboard

Actually, based on [1], this does not mean that, and the RPM packages
do not create such user, so we should switch that to the apache user.

[1] http://modwsgi.readthedocs.io/en/latest/configuration-directives/WSGIDaemonProcess.html

Change-Id: I52766ac0521951cc8c857e51a61823410585bed5

commit_message:
Implement backend usage reporting

This patch adds an API interface to allow the cloud administrator
to view the amount of free and total storage they have for their
backends, as well as their oversubscription ratio.

APIImpact
DocImpact

Partially-implements: blueprint backend-usage-reporting
Change-Id: I68e7c163c5c3f0ff81827fe6426510938f09f18b
Partial-bug: #1380555

commit_message:
Experimental fix for Galera issues

- Fixed GTID parsing
- Moved SST check to mysql_monitor() so that
  it doesn't try to connect to the server when it
  is in process of syncing with other server.

Change-Id: Ib7c932fc63cd52306a232a37f2da687127553174

deep nests in the method.
This patch fixes the docstring and makes the method less depth.

commit_message:
config: remove deprecated ironic.client_log_level

The config option "client_log_level" of the "ironic" section was
deprecated with commit d6baa2ae4d7f18dc2e4845af25c21b95767f46ef since
the Kilo release and this change removes this option.

Closes-Bug: 1365230
Change-Id: I605d4ca5b3924ecf013cbf7e228e713b864d7aa4

commit_message:
Move spec for removing downgrades to right place

The spec for removing downgrades has been approved. The folders for the
specs have been changed in newton and current location of the spec
doens't appear on the correct specs documentation page [1]; rather shows
up on incorrect place [2].

This patch merely moves the spec in the appropriate location.

[1] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/specs/newton/index.html
[2] http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/glance-specs/

Change-Id: Iaa9a764e1fb372608e59c41db8173f2a848bf697

subject: Fix dynamic_inventory.py test bug
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2016-05-05 17:23:06.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/inventory/dynamic_inventory.py', 'tests/test_inventory.py'], 'message': 'Fix dynamic_inventory.py test bug

dynamic_inventory.py implements a test to check for
duplicate hosts assigned to the same IP address
in user supplied inventory.

A test has been written which asserts the output of
the error raised by MultipleHostsWithOneIPError to
equal a string in which two hostnames appear.  Since
the inventory created in dynamic_inventory is a python
dictionary, the ordering of the elements cannot be
guarenteed.  This will cause an occasional failure
during automated testing.

This patch creates a small list of the hostnames
supplied to MultipleHostsWithOneIPError, sorts the
list, and supplies the list index values in place
of the variable names directly.  This will ensure
that our exception text will always match our
assertion during testing.

Change-Id: I43b3c637a3944efb705b5c4f495ab3dba1faf893
'}]
commit_message:
Fix dynamic_inventory.py test bug

dynamic_inventory.py implements a test to check for
duplicate hosts assigned to the same IP address
in user supplied inventory.

A test has been written which asserts the output of
the error raised by MultipleHostsWithOneIPError to
equal a string in which two hostnames appear.  Since
the inventory created in dynamic_inventory is a python
dictionary, the ordering of the elements cannot be
guarenteed.  This will cause an occasional failure
during automated testing.

This patch creates a small list of the hostnames
supplied to MultipleHostsWithOneIPError, sorts the
list, and supplies the list index values in place
of the variable names directly.  This will ensure
that our exception text will always match our
assertion during testing.

Change-Id: I43b3c637a3944efb705b5c4f495ab3dba1faf893

commit_message:
Fix notification listeners usage

Closes-Bug: #1570468

Create the single notification pipeline listener and to aggregate
targets and endpoints in it.

In this implementation the incoming notification msg will be dispatched
in a relevant endpoint by its own filter rule based on publisher id
of a notifier, which sent this message.

Each pipeline notifier has a conforming publisher id based on
a pipeline name in which it to produce messages.

(cherry picked from commit 3bbb67d)

Change-Id: I8d4ae7a4c0d8db1757977266e9052cf161b87bc0

subject: Expose allow parameters for URL discovery
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2016-05-08 17:24:02.000000000', 'files': ['keystoneauth1/identity/base.py', 'keystoneauth1/session.py', 'keystoneauth1/tests/unit/test_session.py', 'keystoneauth1/adapter.py', 'doc/source/using-sessions.rst'], 'message': "Expose allow parameters for URL discovery

The Discover class can fiilter API versions by experimental status, deprecated
status, and unknown status, and potentially more designations in the future.
The parameters that control this were not exposed in the Session or Adapter, so
users could not take advantage of this filtering through normal means. This
patch creates an 'allow' parameter for the Adapter that will get passed down as
keyword arguments into Discover.raw_version_data().

Now, given an unversioned endpoint like:

    $ openstack endpoint show cinder
    +--------------+----------------------------------+
    | Field        | Value                            |
    +--------------+----------------------------------+
    | adminurl     | http://192.168.122.183:8776      |
    | enabled      | True                             |
    | id           | 485107c1d92b41829c331a2dc82aaaeb |
    | internalurl  | http://192.168.122.183:8776      |
    | publicurl    | http://192.168.122.183:8776      |
    | region       | RegionOne                        |
    | service_id   | 01b4f36a173d4c59b31fc95763095373 |
    | service_name | cinder                           |
    | service_type | volume                           |
    +--------------+----------------------------------+

an Adapter can be used like this (this example would be expected to fail
since it disallows the deprecated volume V1 API):

    auth = Password(<auth_params>)
    sess = session.Session(auth=auth)
    adptr = adapter.Adapter(sess)
    adptr.get('<project-id>/volumes',
              endpoint_filter={'service_type': 'volume',
                               'interface': 'public',
                               'version': 1},
              allow={'allow_deprecated': False}))

This is inspired by an abandoned patch to keystoneclient[1] that exposed this
information as a tuple. The problem with exposing it like that is that
raw_version_data() defaults allow_deprecated to True, so including 'deprecated'
in the tuple or not including it would have the same result. Using a dict
allows us to keep the Discover interface the same.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130159

Co-authored-by: Endre Karlson <endre.karlson@hp.com>

Change-Id: I54c29e1c2a4a2b02a3967f4ea108b8d2533616eb
Closes-bug: #1394245
"}]
commit_message:
Expose allow parameters for URL discovery

The Discover class can fiilter API versions by experimental status, deprecated
status, and unknown status, and potentially more designations in the future.
The parameters that control this were not exposed in the Session or Adapter, so
users could not take advantage of this filtering through normal means. This
patch creates an 'allow' parameter for the Adapter that will get passed down as
keyword arguments into Discover.raw_version_data().

Now, given an unversioned endpoint like:

    $ openstack endpoint show cinder
    +--------------+----------------------------------+
    | Field        | Value                            |
    +--------------+----------------------------------+
    | adminurl     | http://192.168.122.183:8776      |
    | enabled      | True                             |
    | id           | 485107c1d92b41829c331a2dc82aaaeb |
    | internalurl  | http://192.168.122.183:8776      |
    | publicurl    | http://192.168.122.183:8776      |
    | region       | RegionOne                        |
    | service_id   | 01b4f36a173d4c59b31fc95763095373 |
    | service_name | cinder                           |
    | service_type | volume                           |
    +--------------+----------------------------------+

an Adapter can be used like this (this example would be expected to fail
since it disallows the deprecated volume V1 API):

    auth = Password(<auth_params>)
    sess = session.Session(auth=auth)
    adptr = adapter.Adapter(sess)
    adptr.get('<project-id>/volumes',
              endpoint_filter={'service_type': 'volume',
                               'interface': 'public',
                               'version': 1},
              allow={'allow_deprecated': False}))

This is inspired by an abandoned patch to keystoneclient[1] that exposed this
information as a tuple. The problem with exposing it like that is that
raw_version_data() defaults allow_deprecated to True, so including 'deprecated'
in the tuple or not including it would have the same result. Using a dict
allows us to keep the Discover interface the same.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/130159

Co-authored-by: Endre Karlson <endre.karlson@hp.com>

Change-Id: I54c29e1c2a4a2b02a3967f4ea108b8d2533616eb
Closes-bug: #1394245

subject: Prevent spawning two VPN agents
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-28 02:53:09.000000000', 'files': ['lib/neutron-legacy'], 'message': "Prevent spawning two VPN agents

Currently, if the VPN devstack plugin is enabled (which is
the method used for VPN in all test jobs), there will be
two VPN agent processes started. This doesn't seem to
affect the tests, but is incorrect.

To resolve this, the proposal is to do this in two steps.
With this commit, the script is modified to start the q-vpn
process, if q-vpn is enabled (legacy), and to only start
q-l3 process, if neither q-vpn nor neutron-vpnaas is enabled.

Once committed, the opertion will be the same - if no VPN
service is enabled, we get q-l3 (correct); if legacy q-vpn is
enabled (only), we get q-vpn (correct); if the plugin is used
(the default), we get two q-vpn processes started (wrong).

With a separate plugin commit (to be pushed next), the plugin
will be renamed to neutron-vpnaas, and then we'll get only
one agent process (q-vpn or neutron-vpnaas) runing. We can't
commit the plugin first, because both the VPN agent and the
q-l3 agent will be started at once (just as bad, if not worse).

Change-Id: I2bb7ac01e619c8a9b22bd517a4ff60d67035dfed
Partial-Bug: 1484141
(cherry picked from commit e4289c88c8007ae942a18a1786fc6fd36f2489c7)
"}]
commit_message:
Prevent spawning two VPN agents

Currently, if the VPN devstack plugin is enabled (which is
the method used for VPN in all test jobs), there will be
two VPN agent processes started. This doesn't seem to
affect the tests, but is incorrect.

To resolve this, the proposal is to do this in two steps.
With this commit, the script is modified to start the q-vpn
process, if q-vpn is enabled (legacy), and to only start
q-l3 process, if neither q-vpn nor neutron-vpnaas is enabled.

Once committed, the opertion will be the same - if no VPN
service is enabled, we get q-l3 (correct); if legacy q-vpn is
enabled (only), we get q-vpn (correct); if the plugin is used
(the default), we get two q-vpn processes started (wrong).

With a separate plugin commit (to be pushed next), the plugin
will be renamed to neutron-vpnaas, and then we'll get only
one agent process (q-vpn or neutron-vpnaas) runing. We can't
commit the plugin first, because both the VPN agent and the
q-l3 agent will be started at once (just as bad, if not worse).

Change-Id: I2bb7ac01e619c8a9b22bd517a4ff60d67035dfed
Partial-Bug: 1484141
(cherry picked from commit e4289c88c8007ae942a18a1786fc6fd36f2489c7)

policy configuration across various projects.

- Setup a nano flavor to avoid Not Host Available issues
- Run just smoke and in serial to avoid out of memory issues
- Setup a floating ip range
- Disable volume snapshot
- dont install python virtualenv
Share the local-net to allow tempest to use it as well.
Create volumes per pass to avoid collisions.

Depends-On: I42216a174930b17a4771e78c639da54e170a288c

commit_message:
Enable tempest tests

Most of the changes are in the integration cookbook, they consist of
- Setup a nano flavor to avoid Not Host Available issues
- Run just smoke and in serial to avoid out of memory issues
- Setup a floating ip range
- Disable volume snapshot
- dont install python virtualenv
Share the local-net to allow tempest to use it as well.
Create volumes per pass to avoid collisions.

Depends-On: I42216a174930b17a4771e78c639da54e170a288c
Change-Id: Ia988fd4a8aec84d3e4dd8c45a4f49eb401875504

commit_message:
don't clone a repo if it already exists

The validation command in particular ends up cloning the same repo
repeatedly. Skip the extra work by checking to see if it already exists.

Change-Id: If56f03be03e37116edb8ee9443c9ab286c9bbdd9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: relax ancestry rules for independent projects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-04-21 19:38:34.000000000', 'files': ['deliverables/_independent/hacking.yaml', 'openstack_releases/cmds/validate.py'], 'message': "relax ancestry rules for independent projects

For cycle-based projects we want to require new releases to be on the
same branch as previous releases in the same series. We do that by
enforcing an ancestry between the commit being tagged and the previous
commits in the series.

For independent projects, we only have one deliverable file for each and
so we need to be able to add new releases from master to the same file
that we're releasing older stable branches. Treat situations where
independent projects have follow-up releases from different branches as
warnings instead of errors.

Fix the existing historical record for hacking by removing the comments.

Change-Id: Ia80c876c8de94259a1a56b9c3d07dbefc3e6d1e5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
relax ancestry rules for independent projects

For cycle-based projects we want to require new releases to be on the
same branch as previous releases in the same series. We do that by
enforcing an ancestry between the commit being tagged and the previous
commits in the series.

For independent projects, we only have one deliverable file for each and
so we need to be able to add new releases from master to the same file
that we're releasing older stable branches. Treat situations where
independent projects have follow-up releases from different branches as
warnings instead of errors.

Fix the existing historical record for hacking by removing the comments.

Change-Id: Ia80c876c8de94259a1a56b9c3d07dbefc3e6d1e5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Ignore domain related config when using with keystone v2
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-09 04:38:49.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/common/clientmanager.py'], 'message': 'Ignore domain related config when using with keystone v2

Currently, "/usr/bin/openstack --insecure token issue"
fails when OS_AUTH_URL and OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION
indicate keystone v2 if OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME or
OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME are set. This patchset ignore domain
related configs if using with keystone v2 and print warning

Change-Id: I8afbda787df7855c3f8e868b0f07cbf3b9cd97fd
Closes-bug: #1447704

commit_message:
Ignore domain related config when using with keystone v2

Currently, "/usr/bin/openstack --insecure token issue"
fails when OS_AUTH_URL and OS_IDENTITY_API_VERSION
indicate keystone v2 if OS_PROJECT_DOMAIN_NAME or
OS_USER_DOMAIN_NAME are set. This patchset ignore domain
related configs if using with keystone v2 and print warning
for each ignored config.

Change-Id: I8afbda787df7855c3f8e868b0f07cbf3b9cd97fd
Closes-bug: #1447704

commit_message:
Fix notification listeners usage

Closes-Bug: #1570468

Create the single notification pipeline listener and to aggregate
targets and endpoints in it.

In this implementation the incoming notification msg will be dispatched
in a relevant endpoint by its own filter rule based on publisher id
of a notifier, which sent this message.

Each pipeline notifier has a conforming publisher id based on
a pipeline name in which it to produce messages.

Change-Id: If8c1c6838fd291ef8dbdd4d27c78fe5a36522178
(cherry picked from commit 726b2d4d67ada3df07f36ecfd81b0cf72881e159)

commit_message:
BankSection: implement get sub-section

Sometimes we wish to access a sub section, for example:
/checkpoints/<checkpoint_id>/file
/indices/by_plan/<plan_id>/<checkpoint_id>
Now we can call `get_sub_section()` on a section, to get a new
BankSection with a nested section.

Change-Id: I86fc2d1cc405b5b4d09c009941535e2e4de0c96b
